program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the dutch have added a new harmony to their free-scoring squad of cup contenders the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday . the two sides will be battling for vital points in their rightly-dubbed " group of death " that also includes two-time world cup winners argentina and this year 's african nations runners-up , ivory coast - also the continent 's strongest team in germany . winning the group will ensure a much easier passage to the quarter-finals and will likely mean avoiding brazil . dutch coach marco van basten , who won the european championship title in 1988 as a player , but is bidding to deliver the dutch their first ever world cup after two losing appearances in the 1974 and 1978 finals , has a wealth of attacking options from which to pick . they include chelsea 's arjen robben , feyenoord 's dirk kuyt , arsenal 's robin van persie and ruud van nistlerooy , a feared goal scorer with something to prove given his current state of limbo at manchester united after falling out with alex ferguson . with van basten employing a 4-3-3 system with two wingers , the onus will be on the forwards to break down serbia and montenegro 's teak-tough defense . montenegro might just have voted for independence from larger cousin serbia , but their defense was united enough to remarkably leak only one goal in 10 qualifying games , that in a 1-1 draw with spain . but they too recognize that they will have their work cut out to contain the dutch , who had the best points-per-game average in qualifying of all of the 32 nations taking part in the world cup - despite being grouped with the czech republic , romania , finland and macedonia in their qualifiers . legend van basten remains grounded as team flies bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : former striker van basten knows about winning in germany " i hope that in effect our performances -lrb- in germany -rrb- in 1974 and 1988 are not merely coincidental , " said van basten , who took over the reins from dick advocaat following euro 2004 when the dutch went out in the semi-finals . " instead i would like us to rubberstamp the idea that we feel good when we play in germany . " " we should benefit from playing so close to home , " van basten said as 15,000 fans turned out to watch the first public dutch training session in freiburg on thursday . " we sense this enthusiasm .
it is now for the players to take that onto the pitch , " said the coach who raised some eyebrows before the tournament when he ditched several of the old guard such as midfielders clarence seedorf and edgar davids , who were often linked with dressing room dissent . winger robben looking no further than opening game bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : first serbia & montenegro then the world for arjen robben robben admitted that group c was probably the toughest of the first stage and that a moment 's hesitation could prove fatal in deciding who progressed to the second round . " i do n't really want to think about the tournament as a whole at the moment but rather focus on the first match against serbia-montenegro , " said robben .
" they are a solid side with classy individuals .
but we also have a squad packed with quality .
we think together , we play really tightly and i am very confident . " " the dutch have players who can take us a long way in the tournament , " robben added .
" however we have to stay alert .
because in our group it may be the merest thing that makes the difference .
it will be a shame to play well but to lose everything because of a slip of concentration . " serb defender goran gavrancic , who plays for dynamo kiev , said : " it is realistic that we can record a good result against the netherlands .
we have the best defense in the qualifiers , and the netherlands has the best attack .
we want to stop them showing it against us . " dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : serbia & montenegro emerging from a recent history scarred by war , the serbia and montenegro team have a chance to aid their country 's healing process with a proud showing at the world cup in germany this summer .
world cup team checks : the netherlands the " oranje " are one of the world cup 's most enigmatic teams .
the dutch regularly produce teams of exceptional skill and attacking prowess but have yet to win the greatest prize .
www-links fifa world cup 2006 the official hompage of the 2006 fifa world cup in germany .

also the continent 's strongest team in germany . winning the group will ensure a much easier passage to the quarter-finals and will likely mean avoiding brazil . dutch coach marco van basten , who won the european championship title in 1988 as a player , but is bidding to deliver the dutch their first ever world cup after two losing appearances in the 1974 and 1978 finals , has a wealth of attacking options from which to pick . they include chelsea 's arjen robben , feyenoord 's dirk kuyt , arsenal 's robin van persie and ruud van nistlerooy , a feared goal scorer with something to prove given his current state of limbo at manchester united after falling out with alex ferguson . with van basten employing a 4-3-3 system with two wingers , the onus will be on the forwards to break down serbia and montenegro 's teak-tough defense . montenegro might just have voted for independence from larger cousin serbia , but their defense was united enough to remarkably leak only one goal in 10 qualifying games , that in a 1-1 draw with spain . but they too recognize that they will have their work cut out to contain the dutch , who had the best points-per-game average in qualifying of all of the 32 nations taking part in the world cup - despite being grouped with the czech republic , romania , finland and macedonia in their qualifiers . legend van basten remains grounded as team flies bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : former striker van basten knows about winning in germany " i hope that in effect our performances -lrb- in germany -rrb- in 1974 and 1988 are not merely coincidental , " said van basten , who took over the reins from dick advocaat following euro 2004 when the dutch went out in the semi-finals . " instead i would like us to rubberstamp the idea that we feel good when we play in germany . " " we should benefit from playing so close to home , " van basten said as 15,000 fans turned out to watch the first public dutch training session in freiburg on thursday . " we sense this enthusiasm .
it is now for the players to take that onto the pitch , " said the coach who raised some eyebrows before the tournament when he ditched several of the old guard such as midfielders clarence seedorf and edgar davids , who were often linked with dressing room dissent . winger robben looking no further than opening game bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : first serbia & montenegro then the world for arjen robben robben admitted that group c was probably the toughest of the first stage and that a moment 's hesitation could prove fatal in deciding who progressed to the second round . " i do n't really want to think about the tournament as a whole at the moment but rather focus on the first match against serbia-montenegro , " said robben .
" they are a solid side with classy individuals .
but we also have a squad packed with quality .
we think together , we play really tightly and i am very confident . " " the dutch have players who can take us a long way in the tournament , " robben added .
" however we have to stay alert .
because in our group it may be the merest thing that makes the difference .
it will be a shame to play well but to lose everything because of a slip of concentration . " serb defender goran gavrancic , who plays for dynamo kiev , said : " it is realistic that we can record a good result against the netherlands .
we have the best defense in the qualifiers , and the netherlands has the best attack .
we want to stop them showing it against us . latest census underlines multicultural german reality -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 11.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 latest census underlines multicultural german reality großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany is waking up and smelling the coffee national census results released this week reveal that germany is fatter , lonelier - and more ethnically diverse than ever before .
it was the first census to cover health and immigration . the recently announced results of the 2005 national census in germany have given an official face to what has been fairly obvious : germans are getting fatter -lrb- 58 percent men and 42 percent of women are overweight -rrb- and more than a quarter of them still ca n't kick their smoking habit . who is german ? of greater political significance however , is the finding , presented on tuesday by president of the federal office of statistics johann hahlen , that nearly one fifth of all germans -lrb- 15.3 million people or 19 percent of the population -rrb- have an immigrant background .
this includes those who have immigrated to germany themselves and may or may not have a german passport , and those with at least one immigrant parent . these statistics , part of the annual census for the very first time , come after a wave of immigration-related discussions spurred by a recent attack on an ethiopian-german in potsdam .
they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .
patchwork families , disillusionment with marriage and a lack of willing caretakers for elderly parents are neither new concerns nor are they unique to germany . according to the census , only 1 percent germany 's 39.2 million households have three or more generations . germans are having fewer children , but apparently they are n't caring for their parents .
the elderly are n't living with their children -lrb- 22 percent of german households consist exclusively of individuals above the age of 65 -rrb- and nor are the middle-aged -lrb- 24 percent of couples live without children -rrb- . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german men , especially divorced men , tend to smoke more than german women taking stock the census results bring warnings as well as reason for cautious optimism .
the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .
dw-world.de spoke to german member of the commission , rita süssmuth , about the challenges in shaping a modern migration policy .
-lrb- june 2 , 2006 -rrb- german government planning integration summit in an attempt to develop a new integration concept , the german government will organize a summit to address a wide range of issues surrounding immigrants and their families .
-lrb- april 23 , 2006 -rrb- study shows germans getting heavier a new report shows that germans are getting fatter .
about one half of the population is overweight .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv on the german national census 05 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . the 2006 fifa world cup live on dw-world.de the next live game on dw-world.de 's ticker will be : serbia & montenegro vs. the netherlands group c outsiders serbia & montenegro get ready to take on the netherlands in front of an enthusiastic crowd in leipzig .
serbia & montenegro 's starting eleven jevric , dragutinovic , gavrancic , n. djordjevic , krstajic , duljaj , stankovic , p. djordjevic , nadj , kezman , milosevic the netherlands ' starting line-up van der sar , mathijsen , van bronckhorst , ooijer , heitinga , cocu , van bommel , sneijder , van nistelrooy , robben , van persie perfect weather for the second game in the so-called group of death the referee for the match is markus merk of germany .
a sell-out crowd of 43,000 eagerly awaits the start of the match .
1. min .
and we 're off ... the netherlands have first possession .
3. min .
the netherlands have more of the ball against their defensively oriented opponents .
5. min .
cocu with a nice pass into the box , but serbia & montenegro are able to clear .
9. min .
free-kick for serbia & montenegro , but van der sar is n't really tested .
11. min .
free-kick for the netherlands just outside the penalty area , but robbern 's effort is weak .
12. min .
good chance for sebia & montenegro in front of the netherlands ' goal , but their strikers get in each other 's way .
16. min .
long ball by coco but van bommel is offside .
17. min .
gooaalll for the netherlands .
17. min .
robben receives a lob pass on the counter-attack and slots it neatly past jevric .
20. min .
serbia & montenegro look a bit disoriented after falling behind early .
21. min .
17 meter blast by robben but jevric holds .
24. min .
the netherlands continue to press , hoping to put the game away early .
27. min .
serbia & montenegro are struggling to generate much pressure up front .
30. min .
van persie header after a cross finds jevric .
31. min .
counterattack by milosevic but van der sar saves easily .
33. min .
yellow card for stankovic after a hard challenge .
36. min .
robben continues to cause problems on the left , missing the goal by centimeters with a low , curling shot 39. min .
not much in the way of offense for serbia & montenegro .
41. min .
koroman substituted in for n. djordjevic serbia & montengro try to bolster attack .
45. min .
the netherlands control the ball , as the first half nears an end . + 1. min .
milosevic fires over the net . + 2. min .
the first half is over .
the netherlands lead deservedly 1-nil , thanks to robben 's goal .
serbia & montenegro need to do more in the second half .
46. min .
zigic substituted in for milosevic 46. min .
the second half is underway .
serbia & montenegro need to be less cautious , if they want to equalize .
47. min .
and serbia & montenegro are pressing .
50. min .
the netherlands counterattack with robben , but his cross finds no takers .
54. min .
the netherlands are reasserting their dominance in midfield .
56. min .
van bronckhorst sees yellow after a foul on koroman .
59. min .
the netherlands substitute landzaat for van bommel .
61. min .
sneijder 's shot from the edge of the box draws a nice save from jevric .
64. min .
koroman sees yellow for complaining .
64. min .
stankovic free-kick clears the bar by meters .
67. min .
striker lluboja replaces kezman .
68. min .
kuijt takes van nistelrooy 's place .
70. min .
koroman tests van der sar .
74. min .
the netherlands seem content with trying to defend their lead .
75. min .
the match enters its final quarter of an hour .
can serbia & montenegro up the pressure ? 79. min .
schneijder free kick sails miles wide .
81. min .
dragutinovic sees yellow after hard challenge .
82. min .
van persie narrowly denied on the resulting free-kick .
84. min .
heitinga punished for delay of game .
85. min .
boulahrouz replaces mathijsen the netherlands are clearly trying to run out the clock .
87. min .
corner kick for serbia & montenegro .
88. min .
the netherlands are able to clear , but robben narrowly misses on the counterattack .
89. min .
yellow for duljaj after hard foul on robben .
netherlands with a free-kick . + 1. min .
mark decides on 3 minutes of injury time . + 2. min .
serbia & montenegro try to mount last attack .
90. min .
and the netherlands hang on for the 1-nil ! + 3 : the men in orange get a deserved 1-nil victory on the back of arjen robben .
serbia & montenegro were unable to generate any real goal chances . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

netherlands start world cup campaign with win -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .
klinsmann springs surprises in naming world cup squad germany world cup squad stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- feedback was that the end for serbia and & montenegro ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

germans protest against ahmadinejad , racism as cup opens -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 31.10.2010 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 germans protest against ahmadinejad , racism as cup opens großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg protest against anti-semitism and ahmadinejad thousands took to the streets in two german cities , both world cup venues , over the weekend to protest against iranian president ahmadinejad and a far-right march . some 1,200 people joined a rally against iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad in the southern german city of nuremberg on sunday , ahead of a world cup match between iran and mexico . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg on sunday waving israeli flags , the demonstrators attacked ahmadinejad 's anti-israel rhetoric and repeated denial of the holocaust at the protest organized by the local jewish community and the german trade union alliance .
bavarian state interior minister günther beckstein said the demonstration was not targeted against the iranian team or the iranian people but against " a man who has placed himself outside civilization . " " a criminal like ahmadinejad is not welcome -lrb- in germany -rrb- , " he said . " let us show that bavaria and germany as well as the entire western world stand firmly by israel and our jewish fellow citizens . " police said the event went off without incident . ahmadinejad condemned for holocaust comments ahmadinejad has been widely condemned for describing the holocaust as a " myth " and calling for israel to be " wiped off the map " . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ahmadinejad 's comments about the holocaust have sparked anger worldwide he has said he would like to attend the soccer ball extravaganza running through july 9 but has made no firm plans .
a source close to him said he would be watching sunday 's game on television in his office in tehran . iranian vice president mohammad aliabadi was granted a german visa and visited the iranian team in nuremberg saturday ahead of their first world cup match sunday . michel friedman , a television presenter and high-profile member of germany 's jewish community , told the rally it was scandalous that aliabadi had been allowed to enter the country . knobloch warns of " anti-semitic alliance " charlotte knobloch , the newly appointed head of germany 's central council of jews said she was worried about an " explosive anti-semitic alliance . " writing in an article in bild am sonntag , knobloch pointed out that neo-nazis in germany wanted to use a game between iran and angola on june 21 in leipzig to " declare their solidarity with the tyrant from tehran . "
knobloch warned that germany could n't just watch events idly . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : charlotte knobloch " we have to prevent that the enemies of the constitution and the iranian dictator do n't join forces to form an anti-semitic alliance , " knobloch wrote . earlier , police broke up a pro-iranian rally by neo-nazis in nuremberg , a former nazi stronghold . the 16 men and women there were dressed in iranian jerseys , hoisting iranian flags and distributing flyers demanding that the demonstration against ahmadinejad be banned , police spokesman peter grösch .
amid the controversy , iran coach branko ivankovic told reporters saturday to stop asking him about politics .
" these political questions are not for me .
i think it 's not for me and it 's not for people here .
please just ask about my team against mexico , " said the croatian . standing up against racism separately , german politicians and celebrities joined thousands of citizens and activists in the western german city of gelsenkirchen on saturday to send a strong message against neo-nazism and xenophobia . the gelsenkirchen event was meant to counter a march planned by the far-right national democratic party -lrb- npd -rrb- on saturday , a day after the city of gelsenkirchen hosted an opening world cup game between poland and ecuador . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : müntefering and the ambassador of ecuador horacio sevilla borja addressing the estimated 5,000 people who gathered in gelsenkirchen to protest against the far-right , germany 's vice chancellor franz müntefering accused the npd of wanting to hijack the soccer world cup in germany to sow xenophobia . " this brown sauce should never again get a chance in germany , never again , " said müntefering .
" we want all people to be able to live here in germany irrespective of their skin color , passport , name and religion .
no one should be scared , " he said . racism debate in germany müntefering 's comments follow warnings last month by a former government spokesman who now heads an anti-racist organization that black soccer fans visiting the country during the world cup should avoid going to areas where neo-nazi attacks had taken place . his remarks triggered fierce debate in germany about so-called no-go areas for dark-skinned foreigners and were followed by a suspected racist attack on a politician of turkish-kurdish origin in eastern berlin . a string of other racist attacks in the east of the country have also put the country on edge . " world attention focused on germany " president of germany 's parliament , the bundestag , norbert lammert , underscored the importance of the anti-neo-nazi demonstration on saturday at a time when the world is looking at germany and particularly gelsenkirchen which hosts a number of world cup games . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans from all over the world are in germany for the world cup " world attention wo n't focused on germany in the next few years the way that it is at present and in the coming weeks , " lammert said . " that 's why we have to lay emphasis on germany presenting itself the way it is : open to the world , tolerant and naturally friendly to foreigners , " he said . dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de leaders say germany open to the world , but urge caution days before the world cup kicks off , leading politicians have underlined germany 's open and tolerant nature .
but chancellor merkel has warned the country must remain vigilant to the threat of attacks against foreigners .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- can the world cup withstand heated race debate ?
germany is working hard to prevent the far right from hijacking the soccer world cup and promote a positive image weeks before the event opens .
will ongoing controversy over racism get in the way ?
-lrb- may 23 , 2006 -rrb- german interior minister : " people will feel safe " in an interview with dw-tv , german interior and sports minister wolfgang schäuble said that all measures had been taken to ensure that the biggest event in germany 's modern history will be safe .
-lrb- june 3 , 2006 -rrb- feedback do you think the far-right in germany could try to hijack the world cup ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .
9800 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .
dw-radio live hits in germany pop from the german top 100 listen live travel discover germany munich offers everything from culture and fashion to relaxation and recreation .
feature life behind the wall dw-tv presents a unique animated depiction of the former german-german border .
dw-radio living in germany learn more about german society by listening to this weekly radio program .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 germans protest against ahmadinejad , racism as cup opens großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg protest against anti-semitism and ahmadinejad thousands took to the streets in two german cities , both world cup venues , over the weekend to protest against iranian president ahmadinejad and a far-right march . some 1,200 people joined a rally against iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad in the southern german city of nuremberg on sunday , ahead of a world cup match between iran and mexico . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg on sunday waving israeli flags , the demonstrators attacked ahmadinejad 's anti-israel rhetoric and repeated denial of the holocaust at the protest organized by the local jewish community and the german trade union alliance .
bavarian state interior minister günther beckstein said the demonstration was not targeted against the iranian team or the iranian people but against " a man who has placed himself outside civilization . " " a criminal like ahmadinejad is not welcome -lrb- in germany -rrb- , " he said . " let us show that bavaria and germany as well as the entire western world stand firmly by israel and our jewish fellow citizens . " police said the event went off without incident . ahmadinejad condemned for holocaust comments ahmadinejad has been widely condemned for describing the holocaust as a " myth " and calling for israel to be " wiped off the map " . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ahmadinejad 's comments about the holocaust have sparked anger worldwide he has said he would like to attend the soccer ball extravaganza running through july 9 but has made no firm plans .
a source close to him said he would be watching sunday 's game on television in his office in tehran . iranian vice president mohammad aliabadi was granted a german visa and visited the iranian team in nuremberg saturday ahead of their first world cup match sunday . michel friedman , a television presenter and high-profile member of germany 's jewish community , told the rally it was scandalous that aliabadi had been allowed to enter the country . knobloch warns of " anti-semitic alliance " charlotte knobloch , the newly appointed head of germany 's central council of jews said she was worried about an " explosive anti-semitic alliance . " writing in an article in bild am sonntag , knobloch pointed out that neo-nazis in germany wanted to use a game between iran and angola on june 21 in leipzig to " declare their solidarity with the tyrant from tehran . "
knobloch warned that germany could n't just watch events idly . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : charlotte knobloch " we have to prevent that the enemies of the constitution and the iranian dictator do n't join forces to form an anti-semitic alliance , " knobloch wrote . earlier , police broke up a pro-iranian rally by neo-nazis in nuremberg , a former nazi stronghold . the 16 men and women there were dressed in iranian jerseys , hoisting iranian flags and distributing flyers demanding that the demonstration against ahmadinejad be banned , police spokesman peter grösch .
amid the controversy , iran coach branko ivankovic told reporters saturday to stop asking him about politics .
" these political questions are not for me .
i think it 's not for me and it 's not for people here .
please just ask about my team against mexico , " said the croatian . standing up against racism separately , german politicians and celebrities joined thousands of citizens and activists in the western german city of gelsenkirchen on saturday to send a strong message against neo-nazism and xenophobia . the gelsenkirchen event was meant to counter a march planned by the far-right national democratic party -lrb- npd -rrb- on saturday , a day after the city of gelsenkirchen hosted an opening world cup game between poland and ecuador . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : müntefering and the ambassador of ecuador horacio sevilla borja addressing the estimated 5,000 people who gathered in gelsenkirchen to protest against the far-right , germany 's vice chancellor franz müntefering accused the npd of wanting to hijack the soccer world cup in germany to sow xenophobia . " this brown sauce should never again get a chance in germany , never again , " said müntefering .
" we want all people to be able to live here in germany irrespective of their skin color , passport , name and religion .
no one should be scared , " he said . racism debate in germany müntefering 's comments follow warnings last month by a former government spokesman who now heads an anti-racist organization that black soccer fans visiting the country during the world cup should avoid going to areas where neo-nazi attacks had taken place . his remarks triggered fierce debate in germany about so-called no-go areas for dark-skinned foreigners and were followed by a suspected racist attack on a politician of turkish-kurdish origin in eastern berlin . a string of other racist attacks in the east of the country have also put the country on edge . " world attention focused on germany " president of germany 's parliament , the bundestag , norbert lammert , underscored the importance of the anti-neo-nazi demonstration on saturday at a time when the world is looking at germany and particularly gelsenkirchen which hosts a number of world cup games . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans from all over the world are in germany for the world cup " world attention wo n't focused on germany in the next few years the way that it is at present and in the coming weeks , " lammert said . " that 's why we have to lay emphasis on germany presenting itself the way it is : open to the world , tolerant and naturally friendly to foreigners , " he said . dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de leaders say germany open to the world , but urge caution days before the world cup kicks off , leading politicians have underlined germany 's open and tolerant nature .
but chancellor merkel has warned the country must remain vigilant to the threat of attacks against foreigners .

" let us show that bavaria and germany as well as the entire western world stand firmly by israel and our jewish fellow citizens . " police said the event went off without incident . ahmadinejad condemned for holocaust comments ahmadinejad has been widely condemned for describing the holocaust as a " myth " and calling for israel to be " wiped off the map " . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ahmadinejad 's comments about the holocaust have sparked anger worldwide he has said he would like to attend the soccer ball extravaganza running through july 9 but has made no firm plans .
a source close to him said he would be watching sunday 's game on television in his office in tehran . iranian vice president mohammad aliabadi was granted a german visa and visited the iranian team in nuremberg saturday ahead of their first world cup match sunday . michel friedman , a television presenter and high-profile member of germany 's jewish community , told the rally it was scandalous that aliabadi had been allowed to enter the country . knobloch warns of " anti-semitic alliance " charlotte knobloch , the newly appointed head of germany 's central council of jews said she was worried about an " explosive anti-semitic alliance . " writing in an article in bild am sonntag , knobloch pointed out that neo-nazis in germany wanted to use a game between iran and angola on june 21 in leipzig to " declare their solidarity with the tyrant from tehran . "
knobloch warned that germany could n't just watch events idly . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : charlotte knobloch " we have to prevent that the enemies of the constitution and the iranian dictator do n't join forces to form an anti-semitic alliance , " knobloch wrote . earlier , police broke up a pro-iranian rally by neo-nazis in nuremberg , a former nazi stronghold . the 16 men and women there were dressed in iranian jerseys , hoisting iranian flags and distributing flyers demanding that the demonstration against ahmadinejad be banned , police spokesman peter grösch .
amid the controversy , iran coach branko ivankovic told reporters saturday to stop asking him about politics .
" these political questions are not for me .
i think it 's not for me and it 's not for people here .
please just ask about my team against mexico , " said the croatian . standing up against racism separately , german politicians and celebrities joined thousands of citizens and activists in the western german city of gelsenkirchen on saturday to send a strong message against neo-nazism and xenophobia . the gelsenkirchen event was meant to counter a march planned by the far-right national democratic party -lrb- npd -rrb- on saturday , a day after the city of gelsenkirchen hosted an opening world cup game between poland and ecuador . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : müntefering and the ambassador of ecuador horacio sevilla borja addressing the estimated 5,000 people who gathered in gelsenkirchen to protest against the far-right , germany 's vice chancellor franz müntefering accused the npd of wanting to hijack the soccer world cup in germany to sow xenophobia . " this brown sauce should never again get a chance in germany , never again , " said müntefering .
" we want all people to be able to live here in germany irrespective of their skin color , passport , name and religion .
no one should be scared , " he said . racism debate in germany müntefering 's comments follow warnings last month by a former government spokesman who now heads an anti-racist organization that black soccer fans visiting the country during the world cup should avoid going to areas where neo-nazi attacks had taken place . his remarks triggered fierce debate in germany about so-called no-go areas for dark-skinned foreigners and were followed by a suspected racist attack on a politician of turkish-kurdish origin in eastern berlin . a string of other racist attacks in the east of the country have also put the country on edge . " world attention focused on germany " president of germany 's parliament , the bundestag , norbert lammert , underscored the importance of the anti-neo-nazi demonstration on saturday at a time when the world is looking at germany and particularly gelsenkirchen which hosts a number of world cup games . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans from all over the world are in germany for the world cup " world attention wo n't focused on germany in the next few years the way that it is at present and in the coming weeks , " lammert said . " that 's why we have to lay emphasis on germany presenting itself the way it is : open to the world , tolerant and naturally friendly to foreigners , " he said . dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de leaders say germany open to the world , but urge caution days before the world cup kicks off , leading politicians have underlined germany 's open and tolerant nature .
but chancellor merkel has warned the country must remain vigilant to the threat of attacks against foreigners .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- can the world cup withstand heated race debate ?
germany is working hard to prevent the far right from hijacking the soccer world cup and promote a positive image weeks before the event opens .
will ongoing controversy over racism get in the way ?
-lrb- may 23 , 2006 -rrb- german interior minister : " people will feel safe " in an interview with dw-tv , german interior and sports minister wolfgang schäuble said that all measures had been taken to ensure that the biggest event in germany 's modern history will be safe .
-lrb- june 3 , 2006 -rrb- feedback do you think the far-right in germany could try to hijack the world cup ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

germans protest against ahmadinejad , racism as cup opens -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 germans protest against ahmadinejad , racism as cup opens großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg protest against anti-semitism and ahmadinejad thousands took to the streets in two german cities , both world cup venues , over the weekend to protest against iranian president ahmadinejad and a far-right march . some 1,200 people joined a rally against iranian president mahmoud ahmadinejad in the southern german city of nuremberg on sunday , ahead of a world cup match between iran and mexico . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : demonstrators in nuremberg on sunday waving israeli flags , the demonstrators attacked ahmadinejad 's anti-israel rhetoric and repeated denial of the holocaust at the protest organized by the local jewish community and the german trade union alliance .
bavarian state interior minister günther beckstein said the demonstration was not targeted against the iranian team or the iranian people but against " a man who has placed himself outside civilization . " " a criminal like ahmadinejad is not welcome -lrb- in germany -rrb- , " he said . " let us show that bavaria and germany as well as the entire western world stand firmly by israel and our jewish fellow citizens . " police said the event went off without incident . ahmadinejad condemned for holocaust comments ahmadinejad has been widely condemned for describing the holocaust as a " myth " and calling for israel to be " wiped off the map " . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ahmadinejad 's comments about the holocaust have sparked anger worldwide he has said he would like to attend the soccer ball extravaganza running through july 9 but has made no firm plans .
a source close to him said he would be watching sunday 's game on television in his office in tehran . iranian vice president mohammad aliabadi was granted a german visa and visited the iranian team in nuremberg saturday ahead of their first world cup match sunday . michel friedman , a television presenter and high-profile member of germany 's jewish community , told the rally it was scandalous that aliabadi had been allowed to enter the country . knobloch warns of " anti-semitic alliance " charlotte knobloch , the newly appointed head of germany 's central council of jews said she was worried about an " explosive anti-semitic alliance . " writing in an article in bild am sonntag , knobloch pointed out that neo-nazis in germany wanted to use a game between iran and angola on june 21 in leipzig to " declare their solidarity with the tyrant from tehran . "
knobloch warned that germany could n't just watch events idly . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : charlotte knobloch " we have to prevent that the enemies of the constitution and the iranian dictator do n't join forces to form an anti-semitic alliance , " knobloch wrote . earlier , police broke up a pro-iranian rally by neo-nazis in nuremberg , a former nazi stronghold . the 16 men and women there were dressed in iranian jerseys , hoisting iranian flags and distributing flyers demanding that the demonstration against ahmadinejad be banned , police spokesman peter grösch .
amid the controversy , iran coach branko ivankovic told reporters saturday to stop asking him about politics .
" these political questions are not for me .
i think it 's not for me and it 's not for people here .
please just ask about my team against mexico , " said the croatian . standing up against racism separately , german politicians and celebrities joined thousands of citizens and activists in the western german city of gelsenkirchen on saturday to send a strong message against neo-nazism and xenophobia . the gelsenkirchen event was meant to counter a march planned by the far-right national democratic party -lrb- npd -rrb- on saturday , a day after the city of gelsenkirchen hosted an opening world cup game between poland and ecuador . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : müntefering and the ambassador of ecuador horacio sevilla borja addressing the estimated 5,000 people who gathered in gelsenkirchen to protest against the far-right , germany 's vice chancellor franz müntefering accused the npd of wanting to hijack the soccer world cup in germany to sow xenophobia . " this brown sauce should never again get a chance in germany , never again , " said müntefering .
" we want all people to be able to live here in germany irrespective of their skin color , passport , name and religion .
no one should be scared , " he said . racism debate in germany müntefering 's comments follow warnings last month by a former government spokesman who now heads an anti-racist organization that black soccer fans visiting the country during the world cup should avoid going to areas where neo-nazi attacks had taken place . his remarks triggered fierce debate in germany about so-called no-go areas for dark-skinned foreigners and were followed by a suspected racist attack on a politician of turkish-kurdish origin in eastern berlin . a string of other racist attacks in the east of the country have also put the country on edge . " world attention focused on germany " president of germany 's parliament , the bundestag , norbert lammert , underscored the importance of the anti-neo-nazi demonstration on saturday at a time when the world is looking at germany and particularly gelsenkirchen which hosts a number of world cup games . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : fans from all over the world are in germany for the world cup " world attention wo n't focused on germany in the next few years the way that it is at present and in the coming weeks , " lammert said . " that 's why we have to lay emphasis on germany presenting itself the way it is : open to the world , tolerant and naturally friendly to foreigners , " he said . dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de leaders say germany open to the world , but urge caution days before the world cup kicks off , leading politicians have underlined germany 's open and tolerant nature .
but chancellor merkel has warned the country must remain vigilant to the threat of attacks against foreigners .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- can the world cup withstand heated race debate ?
germany is working hard to prevent the far right from hijacking the soccer world cup and promote a positive image weeks before the event opens .
will ongoing controversy over racism get in the way ?
-lrb- may 23 , 2006 -rrb- german interior minister : " people will feel safe " in an interview with dw-tv , german interior and sports minister wolfgang schäuble said that all measures had been taken to ensure that the biggest event in germany 's modern history will be safe .
-lrb- june 3 , 2006 -rrb- 9800 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

if you are inside the united states , it is still possible for you to enjoy dw-tv .
for more information , please click here .

" that 's why we have to lay emphasis on germany presenting itself the way it is : open to the world , tolerant and naturally friendly to foreigners , " he said . dw staff -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de leaders say germany open to the world , but urge caution days before the world cup kicks off , leading politicians have underlined germany 's open and tolerant nature .

live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 07.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . group d : angola-portugal welcome to the dw-world.de live ticker for the last game of the 2006 world cup 's third day .
angola play their former colonial rulers portugal in day 's second group d game .
who will be on the field ?
here is a look at the starting lineups : angola : 1-joao ricardo ; 20-loco , 3-jamba , 5-kali , 21-delgado ; 8-andre macanga , 7-paulo figueiredo , 14-mendonca , 11-mateus ; 10-akwa -lrb- c -rrb- , 17-ze kalanga coach : luis oliveira goncalves portugal : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nunovalente ; 19-tiago , 11-sabrosa , 8-petit ; 7-luis figo -lrb- c -rrb- , 9-pauleta , 17-cristiano ronaldo coach : luis felipe scolari referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- an underdog in the truest sense of the term , expect angola to hang back and defend against an aggressively oriented portugal .
1. min .
we 're off portugal starts with the ball .
1. min .
what a start it is ! 14 seconds into the game and the ball is already rolling past the far post .
pauleta nearly got possibly the fastest goal in world cup history .
3. min .
figo crosses and angolan keeper joao ricardo gets his hands on the ball that was too close to his goal for portugal to make anything of .
3. min .
goal portugal ! 4. min .
pauleta did n't waste any time taking the pass from figo , who drew two defenders toward him , and drilling it into the back of the net .
7. min .
cutting the whole defense c. ronaldo dribbles through half the angola defense and is only stopped by stepping on the ball himself .
8. min .
corner angola akwa gives ricardo a bit of push while going up to head the ball away from the goalie and is called for a foul .
10. min .
akwa goes down after giving up one goal , angola push forward with a drive down the right side and akwa is able to head a weak ball towards to goal before falling to the ground .
12. min .
portugal line up a free kick .
12. min .
petit fires a shot that will certainly leave a bruise into the 4-man wall .
15. min .
joao ricardo hit in the stomach a collision between pauleta 's shin and the angolan keeper 's midsection has ricardo on the ground .
hopefully he 's only had the wind knocked out of him .
16. min .
with a bit of ice and a stretch , he 's ready to continue between the pipes .
18. min .
delgado tosses in a short throw-in ; miguel is there first to clear it to midfield .
19. min .
portugal are slowing down the portuguese players are slowing down the game 's tempo , making the rough and tumble angolans look decent .
22. min .
lonely in the back the portuguese defenders have moved up to midfield , leaving goalkeeper ricardo with only the fans in the stands behind the goal to chat to .
24. min .
simano and figo pass between each other , and simano puts the ball over goal , much to ronaldo 's chagrin as he was wide open on the flank .
24. min .
angola shoots mateus unloads from 35 yards out .
the ball sails over the crossbar , but it was enough for fans of both teams to take a gasp .
25. min .
akwa earns praise a bike kick inside the penalty area and now the portuguese defenders are beginning to pull at the forward 's jersey . maybe angola is n't as harmless as everyone thought ? 26. min .
yellow for c. ronaldo the ref warns ronaldo that he is n't at a judo match and gives yellow for a violent kick .
28. min .
this time jamba gets yellow a late tackle earns a booking for the angolan defender .
30. min .
half and hour into the game and angola are showing their passion for soccer with drives forward and aggressive attacks on every 50-50 ball .
32. min .
surprised that the ball landed in front of him , ronaldo is n't able to convert on a cross alone at goal .
34. min .
figueiredo tries his luck at a long-range shot , but it floats well-wide of the post .
35. min .
ding !
ronaldo hammers a header off a figo corner solidly into the crossbar and grabs at his hair in desperation .
37. min .
stymied by delgado 's arm , ronaldo , a well-known hot head who has already been booked once , works to keep his emotions in check .
38. min .
pauleta does n't get any power behind his header and joao ricardo collects it and send the ball to soaring to the center circle .
40. min .
simano slips at the edge of the box , the fans want a penalty kick , but the portuguese player does n't give the referee a look .
42. min .
ronaldo fouled again .
are the angolans trying to provoke him into getting another card and tossed out of the game ? 43. min .
macanga rifles a shot at goal that ricardo can only block over the end line .
nothing comes of the resulting corner .
45. min .
ronaldo rockets a shot after receiving the back pass and ricardo parries it in all-star style .
another case of bad luck for the portuguese .
two minutes of injury time in cologne .
45 + 2. min .
yellow for loco an extended leg attack against figo gets loco a place in the ref 's book .
45 + 2. min .
that 's it for the first half though the scoreboard does n't show the expected blowout -lrb- yet ? -rrb- , on the field , today 's third game has looked like the varsity scrimmaging the jv team .
whenever figo and co. pick up the pace it 's all angola can do to follow the ball back .
46. min .
the second half is underway ! 46. min .
no changes to either team for the second 45 minutes .
47. min .
tiago lifts the ball to simano , ricardo is there to stop the shot .
48. min .
just three minutes in , but ... ... the angolan defenders are doing a better job of swarming around the ball in their own end , keeping portugal from stringing together their trademark passes .
50. min .
what did i do ?
tiago draws a foul in a dangerous spot for figo 's foot .
51. min .
unsure of himself in the goal box , ricardo looses the ball but can take heart in the fact he may have missed it because he was pushed .
52. min .
macanga gets yellow macanga takes out the legs of luis figo - right in front of the ref 's eyes - and is booked .
55. min .
not until the portuguese get into the penalty box , do the angolans seem willing to defend .
57. min .
figo 's corner too long but loco heads it over the line for another corner .
simano shoots , but it 's blocked easily .
59. min .
in a 4-3 pauleta decides to go it alone .
his shot is n't placed well enough and ricardo snaps it out of the air .
60. min .
mantorras is in for akwa the captain hands the armband over to figueiredo .
60. min .
ronaldo makes space for costinha 61. min .
tiago helps in the midfield build up and when the ball comes back to him he fires at goal , ricardo falls on it and punts it away .
63. min .
the magic is missing portugal are doing enough to win the game an hour in , but the artistry expected against a lesser opponent has yet to appear .
65. min .
tiago gets the scorn of the crowd in the form of whistles for his uncreative back pass when supporters had hoped for a quick counter .
67. min .
miguel sprints with the ball toward goal , but kali breaks up the run .
68. min .
what should we do now ?
more than a little bored with what 's happening on the pitch , the crowd has decided to get the wave going .
70. min .
edson comes on for ze kalanga .
71. min .
mantorras , who just came into the game , is set up with angola 's best chance at a chance on goal , but connects with his shin pad instead of his shoe .
73. min .
defensive change for portugal petit is out for maniche .
figo can also be found on the sideline , but he 's only changing his shoes .
76. min .
mexico and iran wo n't be sure what to make of angola or portugal after this match .
the portuguese have a team of excellent players who are n't putting anything together , and angola looks able to stop most of what portugal throws at them .
78. min .
figo shakes his head taking on the current national dance , figo shakes his head in disgust - it 's a move all the portuguese players have been practicing tonight in a disappointing match .
80. min .
nuno valente sees yellow a tackle from behind on mendonca gets valente booked .
81. min .
miloy comes in for figueiredo 82. min .
hugo viana comes on for tiago 84. min .
simano comes close a header goes over the crossbar as simano is closely marked .
83. min .
what a result ! ?
angola wo n't have anything to fear if they bring this result back home .
the portuguese can expect plenty of criticism if the score line does n't change soon .
87. min .
pauleta twists and turns , it 's unclear if he stumbles over his own feet or if an angolan defender is able to poke the ball away .
88. min .
how wide is a field ?
plenty of whistles from the crowd as portugal measure the field 's width in a series of six passes .
89. min .
chance for angola mateus deflects a cross into a corner of the portuguese goal - ricardo is just able to get his hands on it in a shot that brought screams from the angolan fans .
three minutes of injury time in the second half 90 + 1. min .
simano crosses long to figo lets go in time for maniche to fire a shot ricardo pushes over the crossbar .
90 + 3. min .
that 's it in cologne !
and with an immense roar of happiness that the sluggish game has come to an end , the crowd begins to file out of the fifa world cup stadium cologne . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .
klinsmann springs surprises in naming world cup squad germany world cup squad stadiums check out the 12 venues for the 2006 world cup .
world cup 2006 stadiums from the fringe have a laugh read about quirky happenings in thigh-slappin ' germany in this dw-world.de dossier .
visit germany exploring deutschland check out dw-world 's section with tips and reports from all parts of the country . © dw 2011 deutsche welle is not responsible for the content of external websites .

<p>
live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 01.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . group d : angola-portugal welcome to the dw-world.de live ticker for the last game of the 2006 world cup 's third day .
angola play their former colonial rulers portugal in day 's second group d game .
who will be on the field ?
here is a look at the starting lineups : angola : 1-joao ricardo ; 20-loco , 3-jamba , 5-kali , 21-delgado ; 8-andre macanga , 7-paulo figueiredo , 14-mendonca , 11-mateus ; 10-akwa -lrb- c -rrb- , 17-ze kalanga coach : luis oliveira goncalves portugal : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nunovalente ; 19-tiago , 11-sabrosa , 8-petit ; 7-luis figo -lrb- c -rrb- , 9-pauleta , 17-cristiano ronaldo coach : luis felipe scolari referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- an underdog in the truest sense of the term , expect angola to hang back and defend against an aggressively oriented portugal .
1. min .
we 're off portugal starts with the ball .
1. min .
what a start it is ! 14 seconds into the game and the ball is already rolling past the far post .
pauleta nearly got possibly the fastest goal in world cup history .
3. min .
figo crosses and angolan keeper joao ricardo gets his hands on the ball that was too close to his goal for portugal to make anything of .
3. min .
goal portugal ! 4. min .
pauleta did n't waste any time taking the pass from figo , who drew two defenders toward him , and drilling it into the back of the net .
7. min .
cutting the whole defense c. ronaldo dribbles through half the angola defense and is only stopped by stepping on the ball himself .
8. min .
corner angola akwa gives ricardo a bit of push while going up to head the ball away from the goalie and is called for a foul .
10. min .
akwa goes down after giving up one goal , angola push forward with a drive down the right side and akwa is able to head a weak ball towards to goal before falling to the ground .
12. min .
portugal line up a free kick .
12. min .
petit fires a shot that will certainly leave a bruise into the 4-man wall .
15. min .
joao ricardo hit in the stomach a collision between pauleta 's shin and the angolan keeper 's midsection has ricardo on the ground .
hopefully he 's only had the wind knocked out of him .
16. min .
with a bit of ice and a stretch , he 's ready to continue between the pipes .
18. min .
delgado tosses in a short throw-in ; miguel is there first to clear it to midfield .
19. min .
portugal are slowing down the portuguese players are slowing down the game 's tempo , making the rough and tumble angolans look decent .
22. min .
lonely in the back the portuguese defenders have moved up to midfield , leaving goalkeeper ricardo with only the fans in the stands behind the goal to chat to .
24. min .
simano and figo pass between each other , and simano puts the ball over goal , much to ronaldo 's chagrin as he was wide open on the flank .
24. min .
angola shoots mateus unloads from 35 yards out .
the ball sails over the crossbar , but it was enough for fans of both teams to take a gasp .
25. min .
akwa earns praise a bike kick inside the penalty area and now the portuguese defenders are beginning to pull at the forward 's jersey . maybe angola is n't as harmless as everyone thought ? 26. min .
yellow for c. ronaldo the ref warns ronaldo that he is n't at a judo match and gives yellow for a violent kick .
28. min .
this time jamba gets yellow a late tackle earns a booking for the angolan defender .
30. min .
half and hour into the game and angola are showing their passion for soccer with drives forward and aggressive attacks on every 50-50 ball .
32. min .
surprised that the ball landed in front of him , ronaldo is n't able to convert on a cross alone at goal .
34. min .
figueiredo tries his luck at a long-range shot , but it floats well-wide of the post .
35. min .
ding !
ronaldo hammers a header off a figo corner solidly into the crossbar and grabs at his hair in desperation .
37. min .
stymied by delgado 's arm , ronaldo , a well-known hot head who has already been booked once , works to keep his emotions in check .
38. min .
pauleta does n't get any power behind his header and joao ricardo collects it and send the ball to soaring to the center circle .
40. min .
simano slips at the edge of the box , the fans want a penalty kick , but the portuguese player does n't give the referee a look .
42. min .
ronaldo fouled again .
are the angolans trying to provoke him into getting another card and tossed out of the game ? 43. min .
macanga rifles a shot at goal that ricardo can only block over the end line .
nothing comes of the resulting corner .
45. min .
ronaldo rockets a shot after receiving the back pass and ricardo parries it in all-star style .
another case of bad luck for the portuguese .
two minutes of injury time in cologne .
45 + 2. min .
yellow for loco an extended leg attack against figo gets loco a place in the ref 's book .
45 + 2. min .
that 's it for the first half though the scoreboard does n't show the expected blowout -lrb- yet ? -rrb- , on the field , today 's third game has looked like the varsity scrimmaging the jv team .
whenever figo and co. pick up the pace it 's all angola can do to follow the ball back .
46. min .
the second half is underway ! 46. min .
no changes to either team for the second 45 minutes .
47. min .
tiago lifts the ball to simano , ricardo is there to stop the shot .
48. min .
just three minutes in , but ... ... the angolan defenders are doing a better job of swarming around the ball in their own end , keeping portugal from stringing together their trademark passes .
50. min .
what did i do ?
tiago draws a foul in a dangerous spot for figo 's foot .
51. min .
unsure of himself in the goal box , ricardo looses the ball but can take heart in the fact he may have missed it because he was pushed .
52. min .
macanga gets yellow macanga takes out the legs of luis figo - right in front of the ref 's eyes - and is booked .
55. min .
not until the portuguese get into the penalty box , do the angolans seem willing to defend .
57. min .
figo 's corner too long but loco heads it over the line for another corner .
simano shoots , but it 's blocked easily .
59. min .
in a 4-3 pauleta decides to go it alone .
his shot is n't placed well enough and ricardo snaps it out of the air .
60. min .
mantorras is in for akwa the captain hands the armband over to figueiredo .
60. min .
ronaldo makes space for costinha 61. min .
tiago helps in the midfield build up and when the ball comes back to him he fires at goal , ricardo falls on it and punts it away .
63. min .
the magic is missing portugal are doing enough to win the game an hour in , but the artistry expected against a lesser opponent has yet to appear .
65. min .
tiago gets the scorn of the crowd in the form of whistles for his uncreative back pass when supporters had hoped for a quick counter .
67. min .
miguel sprints with the ball toward goal , but kali breaks up the run .
68. min .
what should we do now ?
more than a little bored with what 's happening on the pitch , the crowd has decided to get the wave going .
70. min .
edson comes on for ze kalanga .
71. min .
mantorras , who just came into the game , is set up with angola 's best chance at a chance on goal , but connects with his shin pad instead of his shoe .
73. min .
defensive change for portugal petit is out for maniche .
figo can also be found on the sideline , but he 's only changing his shoes .
76. min .
mexico and iran wo n't be sure what to make of angola or portugal after this match .
the portuguese have a team of excellent players who are n't putting anything together , and angola looks able to stop most of what portugal throws at them .
78. min .
figo shakes his head taking on the current national dance , figo shakes his head in disgust - it 's a move all the portuguese players have been practicing tonight in a disappointing match .
80. min .
nuno valente sees yellow a tackle from behind on mendonca gets valente booked .
81. min .
miloy comes in for figueiredo 82. min .
hugo viana comes on for tiago 84. min .
simano comes close a header goes over the crossbar as simano is closely marked .
83. min .
what a result ! ?
angola wo n't have anything to fear if they bring this result back home .
the portuguese can expect plenty of criticism if the score line does n't change soon .
87. min .
pauleta twists and turns , it 's unclear if he stumbles over his own feet or if an angolan defender is able to poke the ball away .
88. min .
how wide is a field ?
plenty of whistles from the crowd as portugal measure the field 's width in a series of six passes .
89. min .
chance for angola mateus deflects a cross into a corner of the portuguese goal - ricardo is just able to get his hands on it in a shot that brought screams from the angolan fans .
three minutes of injury time in the second half 90 + 1. min .
simano crosses long to figo lets go in time for maniche to fire a shot ricardo pushes over the crossbar .
90 + 3. min .
that 's it in cologne !
and with an immense roar of happiness that the sluggish game has come to an end , the crowd begins to file out of the fifa world cup stadium cologne . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .
