live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 04.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . a packed house has turned out in nuremberg to watch mexico , one of the favorites in group d , take on iran .
mexico 's starting eleven sanchez , salcido , osorio , marquez , pineda , mendez , pardo , torrado , bravo , franco , borgetti iran 's first team mirzapour , kaebi , rezaei , golmohammadi , nosrati , mahdavikia , nekonam , karimi , taymoorian , daei , hashemian the referee is roberto rosetti from italy .
41,000 fans have dressed in red , green and white - the national colors of both teams .
1. min .
and the second match of the day begins - iran have first possession .
3. min .
mahdavikia fires an opening salvo wide well wide of mexico 's goal .
5. min .
iran get off to the better start , winning most of the midfield battles .
8. min .
borgetti seems lost at the front , as mexico have yet to find their rhythm .
11. min .
two major chances for iran , but hashemian fails to find the net .
13. min .
free kick for mexico from 30 meters , but pardo fires it wide .
15. min .
iran get their first corner , but mexico clear .
18. min .
torrado receives yellow after a very reckless challenge against taymoorian .
21. min .
mexico seem to have settled down .
the game is now more balanced .
22. min .
first corner for mexico , but marquez heads over the bar .
24. min .
bravo crosses on the counterattack , but iran are able to clear .
25. min .
mexico are looking more dangerous now , especially on set plays .
27. min .
goooaalll ! for mexico 27. min .
bravo directs the ball into the net after franco heads on a pardo free-kick .
mexico take a deserved 1-nil lead .
31. min .
iran respond with a cross into mexico 's penalty area , but marquez clears .
34. min .
iran attack through the middle but without success .
35. min .
goooaaallll !
iran equalize ! 35. min .
golmohammadi slots home a mahdavikia corner-kick to level things up .
mexico are punished for taking their foot off the gas pedal .
38. min .
mexico free-kick from 30 meters , but marquez hits only iran 's wall .
42. min .
iran 's goal seems to have given them a second wind , as they now have more ball possession .
45. min .
no added time .
the 1-all score reflects a see-saw match .
iran had the better of the start and end of the first half , while mexico controlled the middle phase .
46. min .
mexico 's sinha and perez come on for franco and torrado 46. min .
the second half is underway .
49. min .
mexico look to be the slightly more aggressive side coming out of the dressing rooms .
51. min .
fonseca replaces borgetti top mexican striker limps off the field .
53. min .
corner-kick for mexico , iran are able to clear .
54. min .
iran 's nekounam is booked .
56. min .
mexico are taking control of the midfield , but can they finish without borgetti ? 59. min .
sloppy passing dooms iran 's counterattacks .
62. min .
iran swap madanchi for karimi 65. min .
mexico are increasing pressure in front of iran 's goal but have n't tested keeper mirzapour .
70. min .
fouls galore in nuremberg , but few successful combinations and no goal chances .
73. min .
mexico continue to press but without the necessary inspiration or accuracy .
76. min .
gooaaalll ! for mexico 76. min .
bravo with his second goal of the day after an assist by sinha and a bad defensive mistake by rezaei .
78. min .
another one for mexico .
78. min .
an unmarked sinha heads home what should be the decider .
iran look dead on their feet .
83. min .
mexico still have more ball possession .
it 's hard to imagine iran coming back at this point .
85. min .
mexico continue to attack .
87. min .
iran squander a corner-kick .
that could be their last gasp .
89. min .
nuremberg 's frankenstadion echoes with chants of ole , ole , as the match draws to an end .
90. min .
mexico win 3-1 . + 2 : that 's it .
mexico rack up victory with a little help from their opponents .
iran looked good in the first half but faded badly in the second .
bravo 's second goal sealed their fate . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 06.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . a packed house has turned out in nuremberg to watch mexico , one of the favorites in group d , take on iran .
mexico 's starting eleven sanchez , salcido , osorio , marquez , pineda , mendez , pardo , torrado , bravo , franco , borgetti iran 's first team mirzapour , kaebi , rezaei , golmohammadi , nosrati , mahdavikia , nekonam , karimi , taymoorian , daei , hashemian the referee is roberto rosetti from italy .
41,000 fans have dressed in red , green and white - the national colors of both teams .
1. min .
and the second match of the day begins - iran have first possession .
3. min .
mahdavikia fires an opening salvo wide well wide of mexico 's goal .
5. min .
iran get off to the better start , winning most of the midfield battles .
8. min .
borgetti seems lost at the front , as mexico have yet to find their rhythm .
11. min .
two major chances for iran , but hashemian fails to find the net .
13. min .
free kick for mexico from 30 meters , but pardo fires it wide .
15. min .
iran get their first corner , but mexico clear .
18. min .
torrado receives yellow after a very reckless challenge against taymoorian .
21. min .
mexico seem to have settled down .
the game is now more balanced .
22. min .
first corner for mexico , but marquez heads over the bar .
24. min .
bravo crosses on the counterattack , but iran are able to clear .
25. min .
mexico are looking more dangerous now , especially on set plays .
27. min .
goooaalll ! for mexico 27. min .
bravo directs the ball into the net after franco heads on a pardo free-kick .
mexico take a deserved 1-nil lead .
31. min .
iran respond with a cross into mexico 's penalty area , but marquez clears .
34. min .
iran attack through the middle but without success .
35. min .
goooaaallll !
iran equalize ! 35. min .
golmohammadi slots home a mahdavikia corner-kick to level things up .
mexico are punished for taking their foot off the gas pedal .
38. min .
mexico free-kick from 30 meters , but marquez hits only iran 's wall .
42. min .
iran 's goal seems to have given them a second wind , as they now have more ball possession .
45. min .
no added time .
the 1-all score reflects a see-saw match .
iran had the better of the start and end of the first half , while mexico controlled the middle phase .
46. min .
mexico 's sinha and perez come on for franco and torrado 46. min .
the second half is underway .
49. min .
mexico look to be the slightly more aggressive side coming out of the dressing rooms .
51. min .
fonseca replaces borgetti top mexican striker limps off the field .
53. min .
corner-kick for mexico , iran are able to clear .
54. min .
iran 's nekounam is booked .
56. min .
mexico are taking control of the midfield , but can they finish without borgetti ? 59. min .
sloppy passing dooms iran 's counterattacks .
62. min .
iran swap madanchi for karimi 65. min .
mexico are increasing pressure in front of iran 's goal but have n't tested keeper mirzapour .
70. min .
fouls galore in nuremberg , but few successful combinations and no goal chances .
73. min .
mexico continue to press but without the necessary inspiration or accuracy .
76. min .
gooaaalll ! for mexico 76. min .
bravo with his second goal of the day after an assist by sinha and a bad defensive mistake by rezaei .
78. min .
another one for mexico .

iran look dead on their feet .

it 's hard to imagine iran coming back at this point .

that could be their last gasp .

netherlands start world cup campaign with win -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 15.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- feedback was that the end for serbia and & montenegro ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . a packed house has turned out in nuremberg to watch mexico , one of the favorites in group d , take on iran .
mexico 's starting eleven sanchez , salcido , osorio , marquez , pineda , mendez , pardo , torrado , bravo , franco , borgetti iran 's first team mirzapour , kaebi , rezaei , golmohammadi , nosrati , mahdavikia , nekonam , karimi , taymoorian , daei , hashemian the referee is roberto rosetti from italy .
41,000 fans have dressed in red , green and white - the national colors of both teams .
1. min .
and the second match of the day begins - iran have first possession .
3. min .
mahdavikia fires an opening salvo wide well wide of mexico 's goal .
5. min .
iran get off to the better start , winning most of the midfield battles .
8. min .
borgetti seems lost at the front , as mexico have yet to find their rhythm .
11. min .
two major chances for iran , but hashemian fails to find the net .
13. min .
free kick for mexico from 30 meters , but pardo fires it wide .
15. min .
iran get their first corner , but mexico clear .
18. min .
torrado receives yellow after a very reckless challenge against taymoorian .
21. min .
mexico seem to have settled down .
the game is now more balanced .
22. min .
first corner for mexico , but marquez heads over the bar .
24. min .
bravo crosses on the counterattack , but iran are able to clear .
25. min .
mexico are looking more dangerous now , especially on set plays .
27. min .
goooaalll ! for mexico 27. min .
bravo directs the ball into the net after franco heads on a pardo free-kick .
mexico take a deserved 1-nil lead .
31. min .
iran respond with a cross into mexico 's penalty area , but marquez clears .
34. min .
iran attack through the middle but without success .
35. min .
goooaaallll !
iran equalize ! 35. min .
golmohammadi slots home a mahdavikia corner-kick to level things up .
mexico are punished for taking their foot off the gas pedal .
38. min .
mexico free-kick from 30 meters , but marquez hits only iran 's wall .
42. min .
iran 's goal seems to have given them a second wind , as they now have more ball possession .
45. min .
no added time .
the 1-all score reflects a see-saw match .
iran had the better of the start and end of the first half , while mexico controlled the middle phase .
46. min .
mexico 's sinha and perez come on for franco and torrado 46. min .
the second half is underway .
49. min .
mexico look to be the slightly more aggressive side coming out of the dressing rooms .
51. min .
fonseca replaces borgetti top mexican striker limps off the field .
53. min .
corner-kick for mexico , iran are able to clear .
54. min .
iran 's nekounam is booked .
56. min .
mexico are taking control of the midfield , but can they finish without borgetti ? 59. min .
sloppy passing dooms iran 's counterattacks .
62. min .
iran swap madanchi for karimi 65. min .
mexico are increasing pressure in front of iran 's goal but have n't tested keeper mirzapour .
70. min .
fouls galore in nuremberg , but few successful combinations and no goal chances .
73. min .
mexico continue to press but without the necessary inspiration or accuracy .
76. min .
gooaaalll ! for mexico 76. min .
bravo with his second goal of the day after an assist by sinha and a bad defensive mistake by rezaei .
78. min .
another one for mexico .
78. min .
an unmarked sinha heads home what should be the decider .
iran look dead on their feet .
83. min .
mexico still have more ball possession .
it 's hard to imagine iran coming back at this point .
85. min .
mexico continue to attack .
87. min .
iran squander a corner-kick .
that could be their last gasp .
89. min .
nuremberg 's frankenstadion echoes with chants of ole , ole , as the match draws to an end .
90. min .
mexico win 3-1 . + 2 : that 's it .
mexico rack up victory with a little help from their opponents .
iran looked good in the first half but faded badly in the second .
bravo 's second goal sealed their fate . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 05.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a closely-fought duel mexico and iran arrived in nuremberg for their first match knowing that they had a chance of progressing in a relatively weak group , but after 90 minutes iran were left wondering how their tournament would end . in front of more than 40,000 fans , iran got off to a flying start .
they could have jumped to the lead in the 11th minute , but striker vahid hashemian twice failed to find the net from short range . mexico looked nervous , as though they were afraid of not living up to their role as group favorites behind portugal .
it took them around 20 minutes to settle down and create viable chances on goal , especially on set plays . in the 27th minute they took the lead .
omar bravo directed the ball into the net , after guillermo franco headed on a pavel pardo free-kick . iran struck back some eight minutes later .
yahya golmohammadi slotted home a corner-kick by midfielder mehdi mahdavikia to level the match up as the first half whistle blew . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bravo should have raised two fingers for his pair of goals mexico make game clear in second half mexico started the second half with a shock , when their top striker jared borgetti limped off the pitch in the 51st minute .
still , the mexicans proved to be the better team , having much more of the ball and pinning the iranians in their own half of the field . but mexico needed a bit of help to regain the lead .
mistakes by iranian keeper ebrahim mirzapour and defender rahman rezaei gifted the ball to mexican substitute sinha in the 76th minute .
he quickly found bravo , who put mexico back on top with his second goal of the day . iran looked exhausted , and a couple of minutes later , they allowed sinha to sprint into the penalty area and put the game away with a nifty header .
iran was done .
mexico began their campaign well with a 3-1 win , while iran will have to recover for their make-or-break match against angola on june 16 . dw staff -lrb- jc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran read all the action from the game thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 get all the world cup news from on and off the field brought to you by dw-world.de. 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

they could have jumped to the lead in the 11th minute , but striker vahid hashemian twice failed to find the net from short range . mexico looked nervous , as though they were afraid of not living up to their role as group favorites behind portugal .
it took them around 20 minutes to settle down and create viable chances on goal , especially on set plays . in the 27th minute they took the lead .
omar bravo directed the ball into the net , after guillermo franco headed on a pavel pardo free-kick . iran struck back some eight minutes later .
yahya golmohammadi slotted home a corner-kick by midfielder mehdi mahdavikia to level the match up as the first half whistle blew . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bravo should have raised two fingers for his pair of goals mexico make game clear in second half mexico started the second half with a shock , when their top striker jared borgetti limped off the pitch in the 51st minute .
still , the mexicans proved to be the better team , having much more of the ball and pinning the iranians in their own half of the field . but mexico needed a bit of help to regain the lead .
mistakes by iranian keeper ebrahim mirzapour and defender rahman rezaei gifted the ball to mexican substitute sinha in the 76th minute .
he quickly found bravo , who put mexico back on top with his second goal of the day . iran looked exhausted , and a couple of minutes later , they allowed sinha to sprint into the penalty area and put the game away with a nifty header .
iran was done .
mexico began their campaign well with a 3-1 win , while iran will have to recover for their make-or-break match against angola on june 16 . dw staff -lrb- jc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time .

portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 05.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pauleta , right , used his second chance to score the game winner the score might have been higher and the quality of play better , but portugal will enjoy leaving cologne with a win and angola will be celebrated at home for holding their former rulers to one goal . the second group d match of the day started with the artistry many expected of world cup dark horse portugal when pauleta nearly netted a goal just 14 seconds into the game . but it did n't take pauleta long to make the centimeter corrections he needed to put portugal up a goal .
he trapped a pass from luis figo and fired it home three minutes later with the angolan defense so confused they may have been wondering if they also had 11 players on the field . the one goal turned out to be the height of the game 's excitement as portugal put together only a small handful of decent scoring chances , including portugal 's temperamental cristiano ronaldo thudding a header against the crossbar in the 35th minute . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola needed some time to get warmed up before creating any goal chances after getting the butterflies out , angola got into their first ever world cup game and , though they were clearly less skilled than their opponents , played stretches of soccer that let them leave the field proud of giving up only one goal in an emotionally charged game . star striker akwa produced an adventurous bicycle kick and then portugal keeper ricardo had to be at full stretch to keep out a shot from andre and just before the break angola keeper joao ricardo produced a fine save to deny the omnipresent ronaldo and kept the 750-1 underdogs in the match .
" the first game is always difficult .
but we got the three points and that is the main thing , " pauleta said after the match .
" angola fought their socks off and they made things difficult for us . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de angola face off against former colonial power portugal a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d.
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal all the details as they happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pauleta , right , used his second chance to score the game winner the score might have been higher and the quality of play better , but portugal will enjoy leaving cologne with a win and angola will be celebrated at home for holding their former rulers to one goal . the second group d match of the day started with the artistry many expected of world cup dark horse portugal when pauleta nearly netted a goal just 14 seconds into the game . but it did n't take pauleta long to make the centimeter corrections he needed to put portugal up a goal .
he trapped a pass from luis figo and fired it home three minutes later with the angolan defense so confused they may have been wondering if they also had 11 players on the field . the one goal turned out to be the height of the game 's excitement as portugal put together only a small handful of decent scoring chances , including portugal 's temperamental cristiano ronaldo thudding a header against the crossbar in the 35th minute . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola needed some time to get warmed up before creating any goal chances after getting the butterflies out , angola got into their first ever world cup game and , though they were clearly less skilled than their opponents , played stretches of soccer that let them leave the field proud of giving up only one goal in an emotionally charged game . star striker akwa produced an adventurous bicycle kick and then portugal keeper ricardo had to be at full stretch to keep out a shot from andre and just before the break angola keeper joao ricardo produced a fine save to deny the omnipresent ronaldo and kept the 750-1 underdogs in the match .
" the first game is always difficult .
but we got the three points and that is the main thing , " pauleta said after the match .
" angola fought their socks off and they made things difficult for us . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de angola face off against former colonial power portugal a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d.

portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.12.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pauleta , right , used his second chance to score the game winner the score might have been higher and the quality of play better , but portugal will enjoy leaving cologne with a win and angola will be celebrated at home for holding their former rulers to one goal . the second group d match of the day started with the artistry many expected of world cup dark horse portugal when pauleta nearly netted a goal just 14 seconds into the game . but it did n't take pauleta long to make the centimeter corrections he needed to put portugal up a goal .
he trapped a pass from luis figo and fired it home three minutes later with the angolan defense so confused they may have been wondering if they also had 11 players on the field . the one goal turned out to be the height of the game 's excitement as portugal put together only a small handful of decent scoring chances , including portugal 's temperamental cristiano ronaldo thudding a header against the crossbar in the 35th minute . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola needed some time to get warmed up before creating any goal chances after getting the butterflies out , angola got into their first ever world cup game and , though they were clearly less skilled than their opponents , played stretches of soccer that let them leave the field proud of giving up only one goal in an emotionally charged game . star striker akwa produced an adventurous bicycle kick and then portugal keeper ricardo had to be at full stretch to keep out a shot from andre and just before the break angola keeper joao ricardo produced a fine save to deny the omnipresent ronaldo and kept the 750-1 underdogs in the match .
" the first game is always difficult .
but we got the three points and that is the main thing , " pauleta said after the match .
" angola fought their socks off and they made things difficult for us . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de angola face off against former colonial power portugal a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d.

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pauleta , right , used his second chance to score the game winner the score might have been higher and the quality of play better , but portugal will enjoy leaving cologne with a win and angola will be celebrated at home for holding their former rulers to one goal . the second group d match of the day started with the artistry many expected of world cup dark horse portugal when pauleta nearly netted a goal just 14 seconds into the game . but it did n't take pauleta long to make the centimeter corrections he needed to put portugal up a goal .
he trapped a pass from luis figo and fired it home three minutes later with the angolan defense so confused they may have been wondering if they also had 11 players on the field . the one goal turned out to be the height of the game 's excitement as portugal put together only a small handful of decent scoring chances , including portugal 's temperamental cristiano ronaldo thudding a header against the crossbar in the 35th minute . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola needed some time to get warmed up before creating any goal chances after getting the butterflies out , angola got into their first ever world cup game and , though they were clearly less skilled than their opponents , played stretches of soccer that let them leave the field proud of giving up only one goal in an emotionally charged game . star striker akwa produced an adventurous bicycle kick and then portugal keeper ricardo had to be at full stretch to keep out a shot from andre and just before the break angola keeper joao ricardo produced a fine save to deny the omnipresent ronaldo and kept the 750-1 underdogs in the match .
" the first game is always difficult .
but we got the three points and that is the main thing , " pauleta said after the match .
" angola fought their socks off and they made things difficult for us . program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 portugal come out ahead of former colony on world cup pitch großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : pauleta , right , used his second chance to score the game winner the score might have been higher and the quality of play better , but portugal will enjoy leaving cologne with a win and angola will be celebrated at home for holding their former rulers to one goal . the second group d match of the day started with the artistry many expected of world cup dark horse portugal when pauleta nearly netted a goal just 14 seconds into the game . but it did n't take pauleta long to make the centimeter corrections he needed to put portugal up a goal .

but we got the three points and that is the main thing , " pauleta said after the match .
" angola fought their socks off and they made things difficult for us . live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 05.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . group d : angola-portugal welcome to the dw-world.de live ticker for the last game of the 2006 world cup 's third day .
angola play their former colonial rulers portugal in day 's second group d game .
who will be on the field ?
here is a look at the starting lineups : angola : 1-joao ricardo ; 20-loco , 3-jamba , 5-kali , 21-delgado ; 8-andre macanga , 7-paulo figueiredo , 14-mendonca , 11-mateus ; 10-akwa -lrb- c -rrb- , 17-ze kalanga coach : luis oliveira goncalves portugal : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nunovalente ; 19-tiago , 11-sabrosa , 8-petit ; 7-luis figo -lrb- c -rrb- , 9-pauleta , 17-cristiano ronaldo coach : luis felipe scolari referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- an underdog in the truest sense of the term , expect angola to hang back and defend against an aggressively oriented portugal .
1. min .
we 're off portugal starts with the ball .
1. min .
what a start it is ! 14 seconds into the game and the ball is already rolling past the far post .
pauleta nearly got possibly the fastest goal in world cup history .
3. min .
figo crosses and angolan keeper joao ricardo gets his hands on the ball that was too close to his goal for portugal to make anything of .
3. min .
goal portugal ! 4. min .
pauleta did n't waste any time taking the pass from figo , who drew two defenders toward him , and drilling it into the back of the net .
7. min .
cutting the whole defense c. ronaldo dribbles through half the angola defense and is only stopped by stepping on the ball himself .
8. min .
corner angola akwa gives ricardo a bit of push while going up to head the ball away from the goalie and is called for a foul .
10. min .
akwa goes down after giving up one goal , angola push forward with a drive down the right side and akwa is able to head a weak ball towards to goal before falling to the ground .
12. min .
portugal line up a free kick .
12. min .
petit fires a shot that will certainly leave a bruise into the 4-man wall .
15. min .
joao ricardo hit in the stomach a collision between pauleta 's shin and the angolan keeper 's midsection has ricardo on the ground .
hopefully he 's only had the wind knocked out of him .
16. min .
with a bit of ice and a stretch , he 's ready to continue between the pipes .
18. min .
delgado tosses in a short throw-in ; miguel is there first to clear it to midfield .
19. min .
portugal are slowing down the portuguese players are slowing down the game 's tempo , making the rough and tumble angolans look decent .
22. min .
lonely in the back the portuguese defenders have moved up to midfield , leaving goalkeeper ricardo with only the fans in the stands behind the goal to chat to .
24. min .
simano and figo pass between each other , and simano puts the ball over goal , much to ronaldo 's chagrin as he was wide open on the flank .
24. min .
angola shoots mateus unloads from 35 yards out .
the ball sails over the crossbar , but it was enough for fans of both teams to take a gasp .
25. min .
akwa earns praise a bike kick inside the penalty area and now the portuguese defenders are beginning to pull at the forward 's jersey . maybe angola is n't as harmless as everyone thought ? 26. min .
yellow for c. ronaldo the ref warns ronaldo that he is n't at a judo match and gives yellow for a violent kick .
28. min .
this time jamba gets yellow a late tackle earns a booking for the angolan defender .
30. min .
half and hour into the game and angola are showing their passion for soccer with drives forward and aggressive attacks on every 50-50 ball .
32. min .
surprised that the ball landed in front of him , ronaldo is n't able to convert on a cross alone at goal .
34. min .
figueiredo tries his luck at a long-range shot , but it floats well-wide of the post .
35. min .
ding !
ronaldo hammers a header off a figo corner solidly into the crossbar and grabs at his hair in desperation .
37. min .
stymied by delgado 's arm , ronaldo , a well-known hot head who has already been booked once , works to keep his emotions in check .
38. min .
pauleta does n't get any power behind his header and joao ricardo collects it and send the ball to soaring to the center circle .
40. min .
simano slips at the edge of the box , the fans want a penalty kick , but the portuguese player does n't give the referee a look .
42. min .
ronaldo fouled again .
are the angolans trying to provoke him into getting another card and tossed out of the game ? 43. min .
macanga rifles a shot at goal that ricardo can only block over the end line .
nothing comes of the resulting corner .
45. min .
ronaldo rockets a shot after receiving the back pass and ricardo parries it in all-star style .
another case of bad luck for the portuguese .
two minutes of injury time in cologne .
45 + 2. min .
yellow for loco an extended leg attack against figo gets loco a place in the ref 's book .
45 + 2. min .
that 's it for the first half though the scoreboard does n't show the expected blowout -lrb- yet ? -rrb- , on the field , today 's third game has looked like the varsity scrimmaging the jv team .
whenever figo and co. pick up the pace it 's all angola can do to follow the ball back .
46. min .
the second half is underway ! 46. min .
no changes to either team for the second 45 minutes .
47. min .
tiago lifts the ball to simano , ricardo is there to stop the shot .
48. min .
just three minutes in , but ... ... the angolan defenders are doing a better job of swarming around the ball in their own end , keeping portugal from stringing together their trademark passes .
50. min .
what did i do ?
tiago draws a foul in a dangerous spot for figo 's foot .
51. min .
unsure of himself in the goal box , ricardo looses the ball but can take heart in the fact he may have missed it because he was pushed .
52. min .
macanga gets yellow macanga takes out the legs of luis figo - right in front of the ref 's eyes - and is booked .
55. min .
not until the portuguese get into the penalty box , do the angolans seem willing to defend .
57. min .
figo 's corner too long but loco heads it over the line for another corner .
simano shoots , but it 's blocked easily .
59. min .
in a 4-3 pauleta decides to go it alone .
his shot is n't placed well enough and ricardo snaps it out of the air .
60. min .
mantorras is in for akwa the captain hands the armband over to figueiredo .
60. min .
ronaldo makes space for costinha 61. min .
tiago helps in the midfield build up and when the ball comes back to him he fires at goal , ricardo falls on it and punts it away .
63. min .
the magic is missing portugal are doing enough to win the game an hour in , but the artistry expected against a lesser opponent has yet to appear .
65. min .
tiago gets the scorn of the crowd in the form of whistles for his uncreative back pass when supporters had hoped for a quick counter .
67. min .
miguel sprints with the ball toward goal , but kali breaks up the run .
68. min .
what should we do now ?
more than a little bored with what 's happening on the pitch , the crowd has decided to get the wave going .
70. min .
edson comes on for ze kalanga .
71. min .
mantorras , who just came into the game , is set up with angola 's best chance at a chance on goal , but connects with his shin pad instead of his shoe .
73. min .
defensive change for portugal petit is out for maniche .
figo can also be found on the sideline , but he 's only changing his shoes .
76. min .
mexico and iran wo n't be sure what to make of angola or portugal after this match .
the portuguese have a team of excellent players who are n't putting anything together , and angola looks able to stop most of what portugal throws at them .
78. min .
figo shakes his head taking on the current national dance , figo shakes his head in disgust - it 's a move all the portuguese players have been practicing tonight in a disappointing match .
80. min .
nuno valente sees yellow a tackle from behind on mendonca gets valente booked .
81. min .
miloy comes in for figueiredo 82. min .
hugo viana comes on for tiago 84. min .
simano comes close a header goes over the crossbar as simano is closely marked .
83. min .
what a result ! ?
angola wo n't have anything to fear if they bring this result back home .
the portuguese can expect plenty of criticism if the score line does n't change soon .
87. min .
pauleta twists and turns , it 's unclear if he stumbles over his own feet or if an angolan defender is able to poke the ball away .
88. min .
how wide is a field ?
plenty of whistles from the crowd as portugal measure the field 's width in a series of six passes .
89. min .
chance for angola mateus deflects a cross into a corner of the portuguese goal - ricardo is just able to get his hands on it in a shot that brought screams from the angolan fans .
three minutes of injury time in the second half 90 + 1. min .
simano crosses long to figo lets go in time for maniche to fire a shot ricardo pushes over the crossbar .
90 + 3. min .
that 's it in cologne !
and with an immense roar of happiness that the sluggish game has come to an end , the crowd begins to file out of the fifa world cup stadium cologne . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 07.05.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a closely-fought duel mexico and iran arrived in nuremberg for their first match knowing that they had a chance of progressing in a relatively weak group , but after 90 minutes iran were left wondering how their tournament would end . in front of more than 40,000 fans , iran got off to a flying start .
they could have jumped to the lead in the 11th minute , but striker vahid hashemian twice failed to find the net from short range . mexico looked nervous , as though they were afraid of not living up to their role as group favorites behind portugal .
it took them around 20 minutes to settle down and create viable chances on goal , especially on set plays . in the 27th minute they took the lead .
omar bravo directed the ball into the net , after guillermo franco headed on a pavel pardo free-kick . iran struck back some eight minutes later .
yahya golmohammadi slotted home a corner-kick by midfielder mehdi mahdavikia to level the match up as the first half whistle blew . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bravo should have raised two fingers for his pair of goals mexico make game clear in second half mexico started the second half with a shock , when their top striker jared borgetti limped off the pitch in the 51st minute .
still , the mexicans proved to be the better team , having much more of the ball and pinning the iranians in their own half of the field . but mexico needed a bit of help to regain the lead .
mistakes by iranian keeper ebrahim mirzapour and defender rahman rezaei gifted the ball to mexican substitute sinha in the 76th minute .
he quickly found bravo , who put mexico back on top with his second goal of the day . iran looked exhausted , and a couple of minutes later , they allowed sinha to sprint into the penalty area and put the game away with a nifty header .
iran was done .
mexico began their campaign well with a 3-1 win , while iran will have to recover for their make-or-break match against angola on june 16 . dw staff -lrb- jc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran read all the action from the game thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 get all the world cup news from on and off the field brought to you by dw-world.de. 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 02.04.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a closely-fought duel mexico and iran arrived in nuremberg for their first match knowing that they had a chance of progressing in a relatively weak group , but after 90 minutes iran were left wondering how their tournament would end . in front of more than 40,000 fans , iran got off to a flying start .
they could have jumped to the lead in the 11th minute , but striker vahid hashemian twice failed to find the net from short range . mexico looked nervous , as though they were afraid of not living up to their role as group favorites behind portugal .
it took them around 20 minutes to settle down and create viable chances on goal , especially on set plays . in the 27th minute they took the lead .
omar bravo directed the ball into the net , after guillermo franco headed on a pavel pardo free-kick . iran struck back some eight minutes later .
yahya golmohammadi slotted home a corner-kick by midfielder mehdi mahdavikia to level the match up as the first half whistle blew . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bravo should have raised two fingers for his pair of goals mexico make game clear in second half mexico started the second half with a shock , when their top striker jared borgetti limped off the pitch in the 51st minute .
still , the mexicans proved to be the better team , having much more of the ball and pinning the iranians in their own half of the field . but mexico needed a bit of help to regain the lead .
mistakes by iranian keeper ebrahim mirzapour and defender rahman rezaei gifted the ball to mexican substitute sinha in the 76th minute .
he quickly found bravo , who put mexico back on top with his second goal of the day . iran looked exhausted , and a couple of minutes later , they allowed sinha to sprint into the penalty area and put the game away with a nifty header .
iran was done .
mexico began their campaign well with a 3-1 win , while iran will have to recover for their make-or-break match against angola on june 16 . dw staff -lrb- jc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- live ticker : mexico 3:1 iran read all the action from the game thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 mexico down iran with two goals in three minutes großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a closely-fought duel mexico and iran arrived in nuremberg for their first match knowing that they had a chance of progressing in a relatively weak group , but after 90 minutes iran were left wondering how their tournament would end . in front of more than 40,000 fans , iran got off to a flying start .
they could have jumped to the lead in the 11th minute , but striker vahid hashemian twice failed to find the net from short range . mexico looked nervous , as though they were afraid of not living up to their role as group favorites behind portugal .
it took them around 20 minutes to settle down and create viable chances on goal , especially on set plays . in the 27th minute they took the lead .
omar bravo directed the ball into the net , after guillermo franco headed on a pavel pardo free-kick . iran struck back some eight minutes later .
yahya golmohammadi slotted home a corner-kick by midfielder mehdi mahdavikia to level the match up as the first half whistle blew . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : bravo should have raised two fingers for his pair of goals mexico make game clear in second half mexico started the second half with a shock , when their top striker jared borgetti limped off the pitch in the 51st minute .
still , the mexicans proved to be the better team , having much more of the ball and pinning the iranians in their own half of the field . but mexico needed a bit of help to regain the lead .
mistakes by iranian keeper ebrahim mirzapour and defender rahman rezaei gifted the ball to mexican substitute sinha in the 76th minute .
he quickly found bravo , who put mexico back on top with his second goal of the day . iran looked exhausted , and a couple of minutes later , they allowed sinha to sprint into the penalty area and put the game away with a nifty header .
iran was done .
mexico began their campaign well with a 3-1 win , while iran will have to recover for their make-or-break match against angola on june 16 . dw staff -lrb- jc -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time .

live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 04.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . the 2006 fifa world cup live on dw-world.de the next live game on dw-world.de 's ticker will be : serbia & montenegro vs. the netherlands group c outsiders serbia & montenegro get ready to take on the netherlands in front of an enthusiastic crowd in leipzig .
serbia & montenegro 's starting eleven jevric , dragutinovic , gavrancic , n. djordjevic , krstajic , duljaj , stankovic , p. djordjevic , nadj , kezman , milosevic the netherlands ' starting line-up van der sar , mathijsen , van bronckhorst , ooijer , heitinga , cocu , van bommel , sneijder , van nistelrooy , robben , van persie perfect weather for the second game in the so-called group of death the referee for the match is markus merk of germany .
a sell-out crowd of 43,000 eagerly awaits the start of the match .
1. min .
and we 're off ... the netherlands have first possession .
3. min .
the netherlands have more of the ball against their defensively oriented opponents .
5. min .
cocu with a nice pass into the box , but serbia & montenegro are able to clear .
9. min .
free-kick for serbia & montenegro , but van der sar is n't really tested .
11. min .
free-kick for the netherlands just outside the penalty area , but robbern 's effort is weak .
12. min .
good chance for sebia & montenegro in front of the netherlands ' goal , but their strikers get in each other 's way .
16. min .
long ball by coco but van bommel is offside .
17. min .
gooaalll for the netherlands .
17. min .
robben receives a lob pass on the counter-attack and slots it neatly past jevric .
20. min .
serbia & montenegro look a bit disoriented after falling behind early .
21. min .
17 meter blast by robben but jevric holds .
24. min .
the netherlands continue to press , hoping to put the game away early .
27. min .
serbia & montenegro are struggling to generate much pressure up front .
30. min .
van persie header after a cross finds jevric .
31. min .
counterattack by milosevic but van der sar saves easily .
33. min .
yellow card for stankovic after a hard challenge .
36. min .
robben continues to cause problems on the left , missing the goal by centimeters with a low , curling shot 39. min .
not much in the way of offense for serbia & montenegro .
41. min .
koroman substituted in for n. djordjevic serbia & montengro try to bolster attack .
45. min .
the netherlands control the ball , as the first half nears an end . + 1. min .
milosevic fires over the net . + 2. min .
the first half is over .
the netherlands lead deservedly 1-nil , thanks to robben 's goal .
serbia & montenegro need to do more in the second half .
46. min .
zigic substituted in for milosevic 46. min .
the second half is underway .
serbia & montenegro need to be less cautious , if they want to equalize .
47. min .
and serbia & montenegro are pressing .
50. min .
the netherlands counterattack with robben , but his cross finds no takers .
54. min .
the netherlands are reasserting their dominance in midfield .
56. min .
van bronckhorst sees yellow after a foul on koroman .
59. min .
the netherlands substitute landzaat for van bommel .
61. min .
sneijder 's shot from the edge of the box draws a nice save from jevric .
64. min .
koroman sees yellow for complaining .
64. min .
stankovic free-kick clears the bar by meters .
67. min .
striker lluboja replaces kezman .
68. min .
kuijt takes van nistelrooy 's place .
70. min .
koroman tests van der sar .
74. min .
the netherlands seem content with trying to defend their lead .
75. min .
the match enters its final quarter of an hour .
can serbia & montenegro up the pressure ? 79. min .
schneijder free kick sails miles wide .
81. min .
dragutinovic sees yellow after hard challenge .
82. min .
van persie narrowly denied on the resulting free-kick .
84. min .
heitinga punished for delay of game .
85. min .
boulahrouz replaces mathijsen the netherlands are clearly trying to run out the clock .
87. min .
corner kick for serbia & montenegro .
88. min .
the netherlands are able to clear , but robben narrowly misses on the counterattack .
89. min .
yellow for duljaj after hard foul on robben .
netherlands with a free-kick . + 1. min .
mark decides on 3 minutes of injury time . + 2. min .
serbia & montenegro try to mount last attack .
90. min .
and the netherlands hang on for the 1-nil ! + 3 : the men in orange get a deserved 1-nil victory on the back of arjen robben .
serbia & montenegro were unable to generate any real goal chances . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic 9800 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

serbia & montenegro 's starting eleven jevric , dragutinovic , gavrancic , n. djordjevic , krstajic , duljaj , stankovic , p. djordjevic , nadj , kezman , milosevic the netherlands ' starting line-up van der sar , mathijsen , van bronckhorst , ooijer , heitinga , cocu , van bommel , sneijder , van nistelrooy , robben , van persie perfect weather for the second game in the so-called group of death the referee for the match is markus merk of germany .
a sell-out crowd of 43,000 eagerly awaits the start of the match .
1. min .
and we 're off ... the netherlands have first possession .
3. min .
the netherlands have more of the ball against their defensively oriented opponents .
5. min .
cocu with a nice pass into the box , but serbia & montenegro are able to clear .
9. min .
free-kick for serbia & montenegro , but van der sar is n't really tested .
11. min .
free-kick for the netherlands just outside the penalty area , but robbern 's effort is weak .
12. min .
good chance for sebia & montenegro in front of the netherlands ' goal , but their strikers get in each other 's way .
16. min .
long ball by coco but van bommel is offside .
17. min .
gooaalll for the netherlands .
17. min .
robben receives a lob pass on the counter-attack and slots it neatly past jevric .
20. min .
serbia & montenegro look a bit disoriented after falling behind early .
21. min .
17 meter blast by robben but jevric holds .
24. min .
the netherlands continue to press , hoping to put the game away early .
27. min .
serbia & montenegro are struggling to generate much pressure up front .
30. min .
van persie header after a cross finds jevric .
31. min .
counterattack by milosevic but van der sar saves easily .
33. min .
yellow card for stankovic after a hard challenge .
36. min .
robben continues to cause problems on the left , missing the goal by centimeters with a low , curling shot 39. min .
not much in the way of offense for serbia & montenegro .
41. min .
koroman substituted in for n. djordjevic serbia & montengro try to bolster attack .
45. min .
the netherlands control the ball , as the first half nears an end . + 1. min .
milosevic fires over the net . + 2. min .
the first half is over .
the netherlands lead deservedly 1-nil , thanks to robben 's goal .
serbia & montenegro need to do more in the second half .
46. min .
zigic substituted in for milosevic 46. min .
the second half is underway .
serbia & montenegro need to be less cautious , if they want to equalize .
47. min .
and serbia & montenegro are pressing .

netherlands start world cup campaign with win -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 10.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- feedback was that the end for serbia and & montenegro ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 18.01.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 crunch time comes early for iran against seeded mexico großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : there 'll be no lack of support for iran as the team aims to escape the group stage mexico will be looking to kill off iran 's world cup hopes at the first hurdle on sunday as the world number four begin their campaign to make it past the quarter-finals for the first time . the surprise group d seeds , who have a point to prove after some unflattering reaction to their exalted status , will have been buoyed by iran 's injury problems and indifferent recent form . however they might also take the field without top-rated goalkeeper oswaldo sanchez , who has flown home following his father 's sudden death and is expected to be back hours before the match .
sanchez 's availability for the game will depend on his mental and emotional state . the opening match is seen as critical to the hopes of both teams in a group which also contains portugal and angola . " this is the most important game .
we know the game against portugal will be really hard also so we really need to gain points in this game , " said iran skipper ali daei . mexico will hope to shrug off sanchez 's likely absence and their own unpromising build-up which saw them lose 2-1 to a second-string netherlands team . however a fourth-place finish in last year 's confederations cup - including a 1-0 win over brazil - and a 20-match unbeaten streak have instilled a strong sense of self-belief in ricardo lavolpe 's squad . " mexico are very compact , aggressive and fast - actually , they 're excellent , " said lavolpe 's opposite number branko ivankovic . " sometimes they 're playing very boring , but very successful . " mexico looking to justify top four ranking key player is barcelona rock rafael marquez , who will be looking to make amends for his red card in the knock-out defeat to the united states four years ago . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the talismanic jared borgetti -lrb- l . -rrb- has a point to prove mexico 's all-time top-scorer jared borgetti , who totted up a world-best 14 goals in qualifying , will be hoping to send a message to club manager sam allardyce who left him languishing on the bolton bench this season . mexico have qualified for 13 world cups but have never done better than the last eight on home ground in 1970 and 1986 , reaching the second round in the last three competitions . lavolpe , a member of argentina 's 1978 world cup-winning squad , has courted controversy by calling up naturalised mexicans guillermo franco and antonio naelson , while axing legendary striker cuauhtemoc blanco . iran 's walking wounded already at a disadvantage meanwhile iran , who have set their sights on making round two for the first time , look to have serious problems with several players either ruled out or recovering from injury . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : iran 's players who are fit face a tough time against mexico with key attackers ali karimi and mehdi mahdavikia coming back from ankle and back trouble respectively , defender sattar zare twisted a knee in training and midfielder fereydoon zandi also looks likely to miss out after coming down with a fever . however iran , who have plundered a mine of information on their opponents , remain optimistic that the asian giants could spring a surprise in their " most important game " . " our coaching staff is analysing mexico really well and every player is aware of the mexican players and their style of the game .
we know how to play against mexico , " said captain daei . " i think winning against mexico is not unreachable .
mexico is a very good team but it 's not unbeatable . " the match also has a political dimension with iran , under fire for their president 's comments about the holocaust , playing in the former nazi stronghold of nuremberg . mexico won the two teams ' only previous encounter , a friendly on june 9 , 2001 which ended 2-1 . mexico -lrb- 5-3-2 -rrb- : 1-oswaldo sanchez ; 3-carlos salcido , 14-gonzalo pineda -lrb- 30-1 -rrb- , 4-rafael marquez -lrb- 65-7 -rrb- , 5-ricardo osorio , 15-jose antonio castro ; 6-gerardo torrado , 7-antonio naelson , 8-pavel pardo ; 9-jared borgetti , 10-guillemro franco . coach : ricardo lavolpe iran : -lrb- 4-2-3-1 -rrb- : 1-ebrahim mirzapour ; 13-hossein kaebi , 5-rahman rezaei , 4-yahya golmohammadi , 20-mohammad nosrati ; 2-mehdi mahdavikia , 6-javan nekonam ; 14-andranik teymourian , 9-vahid hashemian , 8-ali karimi ; 10-ali daei coach : branko ivankovic dw staff -lrb- nda -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de ahmadinejad would face cool reception at world cup berlin was reserved in its response to iran 's president saying he would come to the world cup if his team made it beyond the first round .
the head of germany 's soccer association , however , said he would get an earful .
-lrb- june 5 , 2006 -rrb- world cup team checks : iran iranian soccer stars are becoming high profile with many securing big moves into europe and enjoying success there .
the national team is also getting itself a reputation as an up-and-coming side .
world cup team checks : mexico mexico has a big world cup reputation : while failing to ever get past the quarter-finals , mexico is synonymous with flair and the cause of more than a few upsets .
www-links fifa world cup 2006 the official homepage of the 2006 fifa world cup in germany .
feedback do you think iran 's involvement in the world cup will cause problems or lead to a thaw in relations and a change in perceptions ?
please include your full name and country with any reply .
