live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 09.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 live ticker : angola 0:1 portugal review the action as it happened with the run down from dw-world.de 's live world cup ticker . group d : angola-portugal welcome to the dw-world.de live ticker for the last game of the 2006 world cup 's third day .
angola play their former colonial rulers portugal in day 's second group d game .
who will be on the field ?
here is a look at the starting lineups : angola : 1-joao ricardo ; 20-loco , 3-jamba , 5-kali , 21-delgado ; 8-andre macanga , 7-paulo figueiredo , 14-mendonca , 11-mateus ; 10-akwa -lrb- c -rrb- , 17-ze kalanga coach : luis oliveira goncalves portugal : 1-ricardo ; 13-miguel , 16-ricardo carvalho , 5-fernando meira , 14-nunovalente ; 19-tiago , 11-sabrosa , 8-petit ; 7-luis figo -lrb- c -rrb- , 9-pauleta , 17-cristiano ronaldo coach : luis felipe scolari referee : jorge larrionda -lrb- uruguay -rrb- an underdog in the truest sense of the term , expect angola to hang back and defend against an aggressively oriented portugal .
1. min .
we 're off portugal starts with the ball .
1. min .
what a start it is ! 14 seconds into the game and the ball is already rolling past the far post .
pauleta nearly got possibly the fastest goal in world cup history .
3. min .
figo crosses and angolan keeper joao ricardo gets his hands on the ball that was too close to his goal for portugal to make anything of .
3. min .
goal portugal ! 4. min .
pauleta did n't waste any time taking the pass from figo , who drew two defenders toward him , and drilling it into the back of the net .
7. min .
cutting the whole defense c. ronaldo dribbles through half the angola defense and is only stopped by stepping on the ball himself .
8. min .
corner angola akwa gives ricardo a bit of push while going up to head the ball away from the goalie and is called for a foul .
10. min .
akwa goes down after giving up one goal , angola push forward with a drive down the right side and akwa is able to head a weak ball towards to goal before falling to the ground .
12. min .
portugal line up a free kick .
12. min .
petit fires a shot that will certainly leave a bruise into the 4-man wall .
15. min .
joao ricardo hit in the stomach a collision between pauleta 's shin and the angolan keeper 's midsection has ricardo on the ground .
hopefully he 's only had the wind knocked out of him .
16. min .
with a bit of ice and a stretch , he 's ready to continue between the pipes .
18. min .
delgado tosses in a short throw-in ; miguel is there first to clear it to midfield .
19. min .
portugal are slowing down the portuguese players are slowing down the game 's tempo , making the rough and tumble angolans look decent .
22. min .
lonely in the back the portuguese defenders have moved up to midfield , leaving goalkeeper ricardo with only the fans in the stands behind the goal to chat to .
24. min .
simano and figo pass between each other , and simano puts the ball over goal , much to ronaldo 's chagrin as he was wide open on the flank .
24. min .
angola shoots mateus unloads from 35 yards out .
the ball sails over the crossbar , but it was enough for fans of both teams to take a gasp .
25. min .
akwa earns praise a bike kick inside the penalty area and now the portuguese defenders are beginning to pull at the forward 's jersey . maybe angola is n't as harmless as everyone thought ? 26. min .
yellow for c. ronaldo the ref warns ronaldo that he is n't at a judo match and gives yellow for a violent kick .
28. min .
this time jamba gets yellow a late tackle earns a booking for the angolan defender .
30. min .
half and hour into the game and angola are showing their passion for soccer with drives forward and aggressive attacks on every 50-50 ball .
32. min .
surprised that the ball landed in front of him , ronaldo is n't able to convert on a cross alone at goal .
34. min .
figueiredo tries his luck at a long-range shot , but it floats well-wide of the post .
35. min .
ding !
ronaldo hammers a header off a figo corner solidly into the crossbar and grabs at his hair in desperation .
37. min .
stymied by delgado 's arm , ronaldo , a well-known hot head who has already been booked once , works to keep his emotions in check .
38. min .
pauleta does n't get any power behind his header and joao ricardo collects it and send the ball to soaring to the center circle .
40. min .
simano slips at the edge of the box , the fans want a penalty kick , but the portuguese player does n't give the referee a look .
42. min .
ronaldo fouled again .
are the angolans trying to provoke him into getting another card and tossed out of the game ? 43. min .
macanga rifles a shot at goal that ricardo can only block over the end line .
nothing comes of the resulting corner .
45. min .
ronaldo rockets a shot after receiving the back pass and ricardo parries it in all-star style .
another case of bad luck for the portuguese .
two minutes of injury time in cologne .
45 + 2. min .
yellow for loco an extended leg attack against figo gets loco a place in the ref 's book .
45 + 2. min .
that 's it for the first half though the scoreboard does n't show the expected blowout -lrb- yet ? -rrb- , on the field , today 's third game has looked like the varsity scrimmaging the jv team .
whenever figo and co. pick up the pace it 's all angola can do to follow the ball back .
46. min .
the second half is underway ! 46. min .
no changes to either team for the second 45 minutes .
47. min .
tiago lifts the ball to simano , ricardo is there to stop the shot .
48. min .
just three minutes in , but ... ... the angolan defenders are doing a better job of swarming around the ball in their own end , keeping portugal from stringing together their trademark passes .
50. min .
what did i do ?
tiago draws a foul in a dangerous spot for figo 's foot .
51. min .
unsure of himself in the goal box , ricardo looses the ball but can take heart in the fact he may have missed it because he was pushed .
52. min .
macanga gets yellow macanga takes out the legs of luis figo - right in front of the ref 's eyes - and is booked .
55. min .
not until the portuguese get into the penalty box , do the angolans seem willing to defend .
57. min .
figo 's corner too long but loco heads it over the line for another corner .
simano shoots , but it 's blocked easily .
59. min .
in a 4-3 pauleta decides to go it alone .
his shot is n't placed well enough and ricardo snaps it out of the air .
60. min .
mantorras is in for akwa the captain hands the armband over to figueiredo .
60. min .
ronaldo makes space for costinha 61. min .
tiago helps in the midfield build up and when the ball comes back to him he fires at goal , ricardo falls on it and punts it away .
63. min .
the magic is missing portugal are doing enough to win the game an hour in , but the artistry expected against a lesser opponent has yet to appear .
65. min .
tiago gets the scorn of the crowd in the form of whistles for his uncreative back pass when supporters had hoped for a quick counter .
67. min .
miguel sprints with the ball toward goal , but kali breaks up the run .
68. min .
what should we do now ?
more than a little bored with what 's happening on the pitch , the crowd has decided to get the wave going .
70. min .
edson comes on for ze kalanga .
71. min .
mantorras , who just came into the game , is set up with angola 's best chance at a chance on goal , but connects with his shin pad instead of his shoe .
73. min .
defensive change for portugal petit is out for maniche .
figo can also be found on the sideline , but he 's only changing his shoes .
76. min .
mexico and iran wo n't be sure what to make of angola or portugal after this match .
the portuguese have a team of excellent players who are n't putting anything together , and angola looks able to stop most of what portugal throws at them .
78. min .
figo shakes his head taking on the current national dance , figo shakes his head in disgust - it 's a move all the portuguese players have been practicing tonight in a disappointing match .
80. min .
nuno valente sees yellow a tackle from behind on mendonca gets valente booked .
81. min .
miloy comes in for figueiredo 82. min .
hugo viana comes on for tiago 84. min .
simano comes close a header goes over the crossbar as simano is closely marked .
83. min .
what a result ! ?
angola wo n't have anything to fear if they bring this result back home .
the portuguese can expect plenty of criticism if the score line does n't change soon .
87. min .
pauleta twists and turns , it 's unclear if he stumbles over his own feet or if an angolan defender is able to poke the ball away .
88. min .
how wide is a field ?
plenty of whistles from the crowd as portugal measure the field 's width in a series of six passes .
89. min .
chance for angola mateus deflects a cross into a corner of the portuguese goal - ricardo is just able to get his hands on it in a shot that brought screams from the angolan fans .
three minutes of injury time in the second half 90 + 1. min .
simano crosses long to figo lets go in time for maniche to fire a shot ricardo pushes over the crossbar .
90 + 3. min .
that 's it in cologne !
and with an immense roar of happiness that the sluggish game has come to an end , the crowd begins to file out of the fifa world cup stadium cologne . send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic feedback send us an e-mail .

netherlands start world cup campaign with win -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 24.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .
-lrb- june 11 , 2006 -rrb- 9799 picture gallery daily highlights from the world cup the world cup in pictures a nation expects dw-world.de presents germany 's 2006 world cup squad .

netherlands start world cup campaign with win -pipe- match reports -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de match reports -pipe- 11.06.2006 netherlands start world cup campaign with win großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : robben collected his first crown on sunday confirming their palace as world cup title contenders , the netherlands opened with a dominating 1-0 win against serbia and montenegro sunday . combining near total ball possession with patient , momentum building in the midfield and percise passing , marco van basten 's side took three points from their group c opener . clearly the man of the match , holland 's arjen robben netted the only goal of the game in the 18th minute , slotting a left footer past dragoslav jevric after bring set free of the serbian defense on a pass from robin van persie . with argentina beating the ivory coast 2-1 on saturday , this was a must-win match for the dutch in the tournament 's other " group of death " favorites . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : a bit more luck and robben could have had two goals to scream about the serb defense , which conceded only one goal in qualifying , met their match in the doughty robben , who tormented nenad djordjevic down his left wing , opened the scoring and came close to bagging at least three more . the serbs ' best chance came in the 13th minute .
dejan stankovic rounded two defenders and squared the ball which was beaten away from the oncoming savo milosevic and mateja kezman by a diving joris mathijsen , to the relief of dutch captain and goalkeeper edwin van der sar . late first-half serb replacement ognjen koroman gave the dutch-dominated crowd in the 44,000-seater stadium a fright with two cracking shots , one just before and one just after the interval . dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de live ticker : serbia and montenegro 0:1 netherlands all the action as it happened , thanks to the dw-world.de live ticker .
world cup 2006 dw-world.de brings you all the news and information from the 2006 world cup .
flying dutchmen plan raid on fortress serbia & montenegro the attacking flair of the netherlands will come up against the armor-plated defense of serbia and montenegro when the two sides meet in their opening group c game in leipzig sunday .

angola face off against former colonial power portugal -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 09.11.2010 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 angola face off against former colonial power portugal großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola captain fabrice alcebiade maieco will be crucial to the african country 's chances a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d. though all but the most devout of angola supporters do n't expect much more than the occasional goal , angolan players are n't willing to give in before the game gets underway . " sunday is a special game for us , " angolan striker love said .
" it 's the first time in the world cup , made all the more special with the great feeling and history between us and portugal .
there 's great excitement back home , the whole country will be watching this game . " portugal sailed through qualifying without losing a single game and are out to enhance their mixed record in the finals while being mindful of avoiding the fate that befell france , embarrassed by former colony senegal in 2002 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the portuguese refer to their coach simply as " big phil " but luis felipe scolari , who took over the euro 2004 runners-up after guiding brazil to the 2002 title , is not aiming to catch an early flight back to lisbon . portugal sights set on quarter-finals " what we want is to finish in the top eight .
that 's the minimum we 're looking for , " scolari said . " unfortunately in previous years , things did not go well for the portuguese squad , but obviously you also learn with your mistakes , " said defender nuno valente , adding he expects his team to move beyond the first round .
" we are a strong team and we have all that it takes to do it . " portuguese golden boy luis figo refuses to dismiss the 750-1 shots angola as easy pickings . " physically they 're strong and as an african team we have to show them respect , " he said .
" it 's only common sense . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " the players have spoken about that match amongst themselves , it 's always there , but what happened then is n't an issue now , " said angola soccer federation official helio russo . angola , revitalized by coach luis oliveira goncalves , earned their passage to germany when piping african giants nigeria in qualifying , but have been soundly beaten in their three warm-up games . angolan striker love stressed the black antelopes were not in germany to make up the numbers . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : angola another african debutant , angola hope to take their surprising form from their qualifying group into the world cup finals to make their first experience of the championships one to remember .
world cup team checks : portugal while one of europe 's most attacking and flamboyant sides , portugal has failed to make an impact on the world stage .
the euro 2004 runners-up will be hoping to put that right on european soil this summer .
world cup 2006 all the 2006 world cup news , features and background from dw-world.de. feedback who do you think will win ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

angola face off against former colonial power portugal -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 angola face off against former colonial power portugal großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola captain fabrice alcebiade maieco will be crucial to the african country 's chances a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d. though all but the most devout of angola supporters do n't expect much more than the occasional goal , angolan players are n't willing to give in before the game gets underway . " sunday is a special game for us , " angolan striker love said .
" it 's the first time in the world cup , made all the more special with the great feeling and history between us and portugal .
there 's great excitement back home , the whole country will be watching this game . " portugal sailed through qualifying without losing a single game and are out to enhance their mixed record in the finals while being mindful of avoiding the fate that befell france , embarrassed by former colony senegal in 2002 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the portuguese refer to their coach simply as " big phil " but luis felipe scolari , who took over the euro 2004 runners-up after guiding brazil to the 2002 title , is not aiming to catch an early flight back to lisbon . portugal sights set on quarter-finals " what we want is to finish in the top eight .
that 's the minimum we 're looking for , " scolari said . " unfortunately in previous years , things did not go well for the portuguese squad , but obviously you also learn with your mistakes , " said defender nuno valente , adding he expects his team to move beyond the first round .
" we are a strong team and we have all that it takes to do it . " portuguese golden boy luis figo refuses to dismiss the 750-1 shots angola as easy pickings . " physically they 're strong and as an african team we have to show them respect , " he said .
" it 's only common sense . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " the players have spoken about that match amongst themselves , it 's always there , but what happened then is n't an issue now , " said angola soccer federation official helio russo . angola , revitalized by coach luis oliveira goncalves , earned their passage to germany when piping african giants nigeria in qualifying , but have been soundly beaten in their three warm-up games . angolan striker love stressed the black antelopes were not in germany to make up the numbers . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : angola another african debutant , angola hope to take their surprising form from their qualifying group into the world cup finals to make their first experience of the championships one to remember .
world cup team checks : portugal while one of europe 's most attacking and flamboyant sides , portugal has failed to make an impact on the world stage .
the euro 2004 runners-up will be hoping to put that right on european soil this summer .

angola face off against former colonial power portugal -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 24.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 angola face off against former colonial power portugal großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola captain fabrice alcebiade maieco will be crucial to the african country 's chances a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d. though all but the most devout of angola supporters do n't expect much more than the occasional goal , angolan players are n't willing to give in before the game gets underway . " sunday is a special game for us , " angolan striker love said .
" it 's the first time in the world cup , made all the more special with the great feeling and history between us and portugal .
there 's great excitement back home , the whole country will be watching this game . " portugal sailed through qualifying without losing a single game and are out to enhance their mixed record in the finals while being mindful of avoiding the fate that befell france , embarrassed by former colony senegal in 2002 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the portuguese refer to their coach simply as " big phil " but luis felipe scolari , who took over the euro 2004 runners-up after guiding brazil to the 2002 title , is not aiming to catch an early flight back to lisbon . portugal sights set on quarter-finals " what we want is to finish in the top eight .
that 's the minimum we 're looking for , " scolari said . " unfortunately in previous years , things did not go well for the portuguese squad , but obviously you also learn with your mistakes , " said defender nuno valente , adding he expects his team to move beyond the first round .
" we are a strong team and we have all that it takes to do it . " portuguese golden boy luis figo refuses to dismiss the 750-1 shots angola as easy pickings . " physically they 're strong and as an african team we have to show them respect , " he said .
" it 's only common sense . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " the players have spoken about that match amongst themselves , it 's always there , but what happened then is n't an issue now , " said angola soccer federation official helio russo . angola , revitalized by coach luis oliveira goncalves , earned their passage to germany when piping african giants nigeria in qualifying , but have been soundly beaten in their three warm-up games . angolan striker love stressed the black antelopes were not in germany to make up the numbers . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : angola another african debutant , angola hope to take their surprising form from their qualifying group into the world cup finals to make their first experience of the championships one to remember .
world cup team checks : portugal while one of europe 's most attacking and flamboyant sides , portugal has failed to make an impact on the world stage .
the euro 2004 runners-up will be hoping to put that right on european soil this summer .

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 angola face off against former colonial power portugal großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola captain fabrice alcebiade maieco will be crucial to the african country 's chances a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d. though all but the most devout of angola supporters do n't expect much more than the occasional goal , angolan players are n't willing to give in before the game gets underway . " sunday is a special game for us , " angolan striker love said .
" it 's the first time in the world cup , made all the more special with the great feeling and history between us and portugal .
there 's great excitement back home , the whole country will be watching this game . " portugal sailed through qualifying without losing a single game and are out to enhance their mixed record in the finals while being mindful of avoiding the fate that befell france , embarrassed by former colony senegal in 2002 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the portuguese refer to their coach simply as " big phil " but luis felipe scolari , who took over the euro 2004 runners-up after guiding brazil to the 2002 title , is not aiming to catch an early flight back to lisbon . portugal sights set on quarter-finals " what we want is to finish in the top eight .
that 's the minimum we 're looking for , " scolari said . " unfortunately in previous years , things did not go well for the portuguese squad , but obviously you also learn with your mistakes , " said defender nuno valente , adding he expects his team to move beyond the first round .
" we are a strong team and we have all that it takes to do it . " portuguese golden boy luis figo refuses to dismiss the 750-1 shots angola as easy pickings . " physically they 're strong and as an african team we have to show them respect , " he said .
" it 's only common sense . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " the players have spoken about that match amongst themselves , it 's always there , but what happened then is n't an issue now , " said angola soccer federation official helio russo . angola , revitalized by coach luis oliveira goncalves , earned their passage to germany when piping african giants nigeria in qualifying , but have been soundly beaten in their three warm-up games . angolan striker love stressed the black antelopes were not in germany to make up the numbers . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : angola another african debutant , angola hope to take their surprising form from their qualifying group into the world cup finals to make their first experience of the championships one to remember .
world cup team checks : portugal while one of europe 's most attacking and flamboyant sides , portugal has failed to make an impact on the world stage .
the euro 2004 runners-up will be hoping to put that right on european soil this summer .

angola face off against former colonial power portugal -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 18.01.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?

program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 angola face off against former colonial power portugal großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : angola captain fabrice alcebiade maieco will be crucial to the african country 's chances a win in their opening match against portugal would mean more than three points for angola .
the african nation would cherish being able to put their one-time colonial rulers at the bottom of group d. though all but the most devout of angola supporters do n't expect much more than the occasional goal , angolan players are n't willing to give in before the game gets underway . " sunday is a special game for us , " angolan striker love said .
" it 's the first time in the world cup , made all the more special with the great feeling and history between us and portugal .
there 's great excitement back home , the whole country will be watching this game . " portugal sailed through qualifying without losing a single game and are out to enhance their mixed record in the finals while being mindful of avoiding the fate that befell france , embarrassed by former colony senegal in 2002 . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the portuguese refer to their coach simply as " big phil " but luis felipe scolari , who took over the euro 2004 runners-up after guiding brazil to the 2002 title , is not aiming to catch an early flight back to lisbon . portugal sights set on quarter-finals " what we want is to finish in the top eight .
that 's the minimum we 're looking for , " scolari said . " unfortunately in previous years , things did not go well for the portuguese squad , but obviously you also learn with your mistakes , " said defender nuno valente , adding he expects his team to move beyond the first round .
" we are a strong team and we have all that it takes to do it . " portuguese golden boy luis figo refuses to dismiss the 750-1 shots angola as easy pickings . " physically they 're strong and as an african team we have to show them respect , " he said .
" it 's only common sense . " bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " the players have spoken about that match amongst themselves , it 's always there , but what happened then is n't an issue now , " said angola soccer federation official helio russo . angola , revitalized by coach luis oliveira goncalves , earned their passage to germany when piping african giants nigeria in qualifying , but have been soundly beaten in their three warm-up games . angolan striker love stressed the black antelopes were not in germany to make up the numbers . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . " dw staff -lrb- sms -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de world cup team checks : angola another african debutant , angola hope to take their surprising form from their qualifying group into the world cup finals to make their first experience of the championships one to remember .
world cup team checks : portugal while one of europe 's most attacking and flamboyant sides , portugal has failed to make an impact on the world stage .
the euro 2004 runners-up will be hoping to put that right on european soil this summer .

" bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : portugal lost to greece in the 2004 european championships last match ended in chaos portugal and angola have met twice before , most recently in a 2001 game in lisbon that ended with fireworks . the " friendly " descended into a brawl , with four angolan players sent off and the game halted with portugal leading 5-1 . " we 're in a tough group but we 'll be doing the best we can to show the world we can play soccer . ukraine 's blokhin : " our strength lies in our team spirit " -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 24.07.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio about dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : interviews with the stars oliver kahn : germany can win the soccer world cup us goalie : pressure will be on european teams " klinsmann has put together a good team " us counting on fan support in kaiserslautern world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 ukraine 's blokhin : " our strength lies in our team spirit " großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : oleg blokhin is a world cup legend himself ukraine is hoping for a successful stint at the world cup even though star striker andrei shevchenko is still recovering from an injury .
dw-world.de spoke with national coach oleg blokhin about the country 's chances . appointed in 2003 as coach of the ukrainian national team , oleg blokhin is a world cup legend himself .
the ukrainian represented the soviet union in the world cup finals in 1982 and 1986 .
he is regarded as soviet soccer 's best player ever . dw-world.de : ukraine managed to qualify for the world cup for the first time .
what was the key to your success ? oleg blokhin : our single-mindedness and confidence were decisive .
when the world cup qualification rounds first began , no one believed that we would make it , in particular against strong teams such as european champion greece as well as denmark and turkey .
but i still managed to convince my boys that we were up to the challenge . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the ukrainian team celebrates after qualifying for the world cup for the first time is the world cup frenzy palpable in ukraine ? just like everywhere else in the world , you have been able to feel the world cup fever in ukraine for the past half year .
you notice it particularly with the growing number of journalists who want to interview me or the national players .
but we could completely focus on the world cup only after the ukrainian national league championships were over on may 14 .
the national team lost a week of preparation due to that .
we could have really used that week for a few players to relax fully before we began with the world cup training . what 's the atmosphere like within the team ?
do you think all that excitement can be damaging ? we 're prepared to perform well and we understand how important the world cup is for the image of our country as well for every individual player .
i notice that our players are slightly excited , but it 's important that we keep together .
the excitement should n't affect our performance ; it 's a normal condition for every player before each game .
if the player does n't feel any excitement , it means that he 's achieved everything and can end his career . which game in the preliminary round do you consider to be the most important ? the game against spain will be important because it 's the first one .
it will strongly determine the further constellation in our group .
but the two other games are equally important ; that 's why we 'll have to give every game our best .
there are no " games to fill the gap " in a world cup and no weak opponents . who 's the most dangerous opponent in group h ?
and why ? spain is one of the favorites of the tournament , and that 's why we 're preparing thoroughly for this game .
but i consider another team to be the most dangerous opponent and that 's tunisia . african teams are famous for springing surprises .
i think a team that 's coached by roger lemerre is capable of surprises during the world cup 2006 . do you also reckon with stiff competition from saudi arabia ? saudi arabia had more time to prepare , and that does play a big role .
i think we do have to take this team seriously ; it certainly wo n't let itself be just a whipping boy . what is the main strength of the ukrainian team ? our strength lies in our team spirit . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ukrainian star striker shevchenko , center , with teammates and what are your weaknesses ? they include personnel problems as well as injuries that have plagued us during our entire preparation phase .
until now we have n't played any test games in the combination that i 'd like to see on the pitch .
andrei shevchenko , sergei rebrov as well as oleg gusev have only trained separately from the rest of the team until now .
our most important man in the defense line-up , sergei fiodorov , wo n't be there at all due to an injury .
four other players had to take part in the junior european championships in portugal until june 4 and are completely exhausted .
i ca n't rely on them 100 percent . which teams do you think have the best chances of making it to the finals ? brazil , italy and germany .
germany 's playing on home turf .
we have a saying : even the walls help you at home .
in addition , it could very well be that the referees are more partial towards the germans . many experts say the success of the ukrainian team depends on whether andrei shevchenko is fit .
is he the only key player in the team ? it 's true that shevchenko does lead the team .
but we 'll be in good form independent of whether he 'll be fit after his last injury and whether he 's in good shape or not .
our performance is n't only based on his dominating role though his talent , and charisma is really important to us and unpleasant to the opponents . what goals do you have at the world cup ? our first goal is to reach the round of 18 .
if we manage that , then we can identify further goals . tatiana petrenko interviewed oleg blokhin -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany welcomes the walking wounded the world cup risks being diminished by a number of high-profile absentees .
could the amount of games played in a season threaten the prestige of future cups ?
would a compulsory winter break ensure more stars are fit ?
-lrb- may 29 , 2006 -rrb- interviews with the stars dw-world.de 's interview series gives you the chance to hear from the people who have the most to say when it comes to events on world soccer 's biggest stage .
ronaldinho : this will be brazil 's world cup midfielder ronaldinho is considered by many to be the world 's best soccer player .
dw-world.de spoke with the two-time world footballer of the year about the world cup , family and racism .
-lrb- april 17 , 2006 -rrb- 9799 dw-tv europe live im focus - dokumentationen und reportagen we 're sorry , due to legal issues this content can not be transmitted as live stream .

latest census underlines multicultural german reality -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.03.2011 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 latest census underlines multicultural german reality großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany is waking up and smelling the coffee national census results released this week reveal that germany is fatter , lonelier - and more ethnically diverse than ever before .
it was the first census to cover health and immigration . the recently announced results of the 2005 national census in germany have given an official face to what has been fairly obvious : germans are getting fatter -lrb- 58 percent men and 42 percent of women are overweight -rrb- and more than a quarter of them still ca n't kick their smoking habit . who is german ? of greater political significance however , is the finding , presented on tuesday by president of the federal office of statistics johann hahlen , that nearly one fifth of all germans -lrb- 15.3 million people or 19 percent of the population -rrb- have an immigrant background .
this includes those who have immigrated to germany themselves and may or may not have a german passport , and those with at least one immigrant parent . these statistics , part of the annual census for the very first time , come after a wave of immigration-related discussions spurred by a recent attack on an ethiopian-german in potsdam .
they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .
patchwork families , disillusionment with marriage and a lack of willing caretakers for elderly parents are neither new concerns nor are they unique to germany . according to the census , only 1 percent germany 's 39.2 million households have three or more generations . germans are having fewer children , but apparently they are n't caring for their parents .
the elderly are n't living with their children -lrb- 22 percent of german households consist exclusively of individuals above the age of 65 -rrb- and nor are the middle-aged -lrb- 24 percent of couples live without children -rrb- . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german men , especially divorced men , tend to smoke more than german women taking stock the census results bring warnings as well as reason for cautious optimism .
the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .
dw-world.de spoke to german member of the commission , rita süssmuth , about the challenges in shaping a modern migration policy .
-lrb- june 2 , 2006 -rrb- german government planning integration summit in an attempt to develop a new integration concept , the german government will organize a summit to address a wide range of issues surrounding immigrants and their families .
-lrb- april 23 , 2006 -rrb- study shows germans getting heavier a new report shows that germans are getting fatter .
about one half of the population is overweight .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv on the german national census feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

this includes those who have immigrated to germany themselves and may or may not have a german passport , and those with at least one immigrant parent . these statistics , part of the annual census for the very first time , come after a wave of immigration-related discussions spurred by a recent attack on an ethiopian-german in potsdam .
they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .
patchwork families , disillusionment with marriage and a lack of willing caretakers for elderly parents are neither new concerns nor are they unique to germany . according to the census , only 1 percent germany 's 39.2 million households have three or more generations . germans are having fewer children , but apparently they are n't caring for their parents .
the elderly are n't living with their children -lrb- 22 percent of german households consist exclusively of individuals above the age of 65 -rrb- and nor are the middle-aged -lrb- 24 percent of couples live without children -rrb- . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german men , especially divorced men , tend to smoke more than german women taking stock the census results bring warnings as well as reason for cautious optimism .
the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .
dw-world.de spoke to german member of the commission , rita süssmuth , about the challenges in shaping a modern migration policy .
-lrb- june 2 , 2006 -rrb- german government planning integration summit in an attempt to develop a new integration concept , the german government will organize a summit to address a wide range of issues surrounding immigrants and their families .
-lrb- april 23 , 2006 -rrb- study shows germans getting heavier a new report shows that germans are getting fatter .
about one half of the population is overweight .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv on the german national census feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

feature life behind the wall dw-tv presents a unique animated depiction of the former german-german border .

latest census underlines multicultural german reality -pipe- germany -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 27.10.2010 home news germany german reunification europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
programs reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de germany -pipe- 11.06.2006 latest census underlines multicultural german reality großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : germany is waking up and smelling the coffee national census results released this week reveal that germany is fatter , lonelier - and more ethnically diverse than ever before .
it was the first census to cover health and immigration . the recently announced results of the 2005 national census in germany have given an official face to what has been fairly obvious : germans are getting fatter -lrb- 58 percent men and 42 percent of women are overweight -rrb- and more than a quarter of them still ca n't kick their smoking habit . who is german ? of greater political significance however , is the finding , presented on tuesday by president of the federal office of statistics johann hahlen , that nearly one fifth of all germans -lrb- 15.3 million people or 19 percent of the population -rrb- have an immigrant background .
this includes those who have immigrated to germany themselves and may or may not have a german passport , and those with at least one immigrant parent . these statistics , part of the annual census for the very first time , come after a wave of immigration-related discussions spurred by a recent attack on an ethiopian-german in potsdam .
they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .
patchwork families , disillusionment with marriage and a lack of willing caretakers for elderly parents are neither new concerns nor are they unique to germany . according to the census , only 1 percent germany 's 39.2 million households have three or more generations . germans are having fewer children , but apparently they are n't caring for their parents .
the elderly are n't living with their children -lrb- 22 percent of german households consist exclusively of individuals above the age of 65 -rrb- and nor are the middle-aged -lrb- 24 percent of couples live without children -rrb- . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german men , especially divorced men , tend to smoke more than german women taking stock the census results bring warnings as well as reason for cautious optimism .
the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .
dw-world.de spoke to german member of the commission , rita süssmuth , about the challenges in shaping a modern migration policy .
-lrb- june 2 , 2006 -rrb- german government planning integration summit in an attempt to develop a new integration concept , the german government will organize a summit to address a wide range of issues surrounding immigrants and their families .
-lrb- april 23 , 2006 -rrb- study shows germans getting heavier a new report shows that germans are getting fatter .
about one half of the population is overweight .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv on the german national census feedback send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .

they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .

the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .

they also follow a recent exposé on violence and poor conditions in schools with immigrant majorities . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : learning german is the key to integration not everyone fits the mould the census is yet another sign that germany has to tackle the burning issue of integration of immigration and face up to its serious failings in the matter in the past . for decades germany has been content to treat all immigrants like " gastarbeiter " - pretending they will return to their home country at some point . ethnic germans from the former soviet union were hastily given passports after world war two and expected to assimilate on their own . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : coexisting is n't enough redefining family the ongoing evolution of the family is another matter raised by the census results , which has both social and political ramifications .
patchwork families , disillusionment with marriage and a lack of willing caretakers for elderly parents are neither new concerns nor are they unique to germany . according to the census , only 1 percent germany 's 39.2 million households have three or more generations . germans are having fewer children , but apparently they are n't caring for their parents .
the elderly are n't living with their children -lrb- 22 percent of german households consist exclusively of individuals above the age of 65 -rrb- and nor are the middle-aged -lrb- 24 percent of couples live without children -rrb- . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : german men , especially divorced men , tend to smoke more than german women taking stock the census results bring warnings as well as reason for cautious optimism .
the country is rich in cultural diversity but is recognizing the need to rethink its immigration strategy . and even if smoking rates are high , they are down 2 percent than in 1999 .
as for the expanding waistlines - well , blame mcdonald 's . dw staff -lrb- kjb -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de " integration is not a one-way street " the un commission on international migration released a new report this week .
dw-world.de spoke to german member of the commission , rita süssmuth , about the challenges in shaping a modern migration policy .
-lrb- june 2 , 2006 -rrb- german government planning integration summit in an attempt to develop a new integration concept , the german government will organize a summit to address a wide range of issues surrounding immigrants and their families .
-lrb- april 23 , 2006 -rrb- study shows germans getting heavier a new report shows that germans are getting fatter .
about one half of the population is overweight .
-lrb- june 6 , 2006 -rrb- audios and videos on the topic dw-tv on the german national census 9799 radio news listen to world headlines from the top of the hour .

ukraine 's blokhin : " our strength lies in our team spirit " -pipe- world cup 2006 -pipe- deutsche welle -pipe- 11.06.2006 main content main navigation extra content head navigation search choose form 30 languages about us press business & sales dw-akademie dw-store contact help partner site map archive search keywords search extended search your link to germany choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages choose from 30 languages english german chinese spanish portuguese for brazil arabic russian persian albanian amharic bengali bosnian b / h / s bulgarian croatian dari french greek hausa hindi indonesian kiswahili macedonian pashto polish portuguese for africa romanian serbian turkish ukrainian urdu choose from 30 languages 26.03.2011 home news germany europe world asia business science & technology environment & development culture & lifestyle sports germany info visit germany facts about germany study in germany german courses learning german deutsch unterrichten german xxl dw-radio what 's on ?
reception audio on demand learning by ear dw-tv what 's on ?
program guide programs video on demand reception about dw-tv interactive reader response newsletters web tools and services podcasting mobile about dw-world.de in focus : interviews with the stars oliver kahn : germany can win the soccer world cup us goalie : pressure will be on european teams " klinsmann has put together a good team " us counting on fan support in kaiserslautern world cup 2006 -pipe- 11.06.2006 ukraine 's blokhin : " our strength lies in our team spirit " großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : oleg blokhin is a world cup legend himself ukraine is hoping for a successful stint at the world cup even though star striker andrei shevchenko is still recovering from an injury .
dw-world.de spoke with national coach oleg blokhin about the country 's chances . appointed in 2003 as coach of the ukrainian national team , oleg blokhin is a world cup legend himself .
the ukrainian represented the soviet union in the world cup finals in 1982 and 1986 .
he is regarded as soviet soccer 's best player ever . dw-world.de : ukraine managed to qualify for the world cup for the first time .
what was the key to your success ? oleg blokhin : our single-mindedness and confidence were decisive .
when the world cup qualification rounds first began , no one believed that we would make it , in particular against strong teams such as european champion greece as well as denmark and turkey .
but i still managed to convince my boys that we were up to the challenge . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : the ukrainian team celebrates after qualifying for the world cup for the first time is the world cup frenzy palpable in ukraine ? just like everywhere else in the world , you have been able to feel the world cup fever in ukraine for the past half year .
you notice it particularly with the growing number of journalists who want to interview me or the national players .
but we could completely focus on the world cup only after the ukrainian national league championships were over on may 14 .
the national team lost a week of preparation due to that .
we could have really used that week for a few players to relax fully before we began with the world cup training . what 's the atmosphere like within the team ?
do you think all that excitement can be damaging ? we 're prepared to perform well and we understand how important the world cup is for the image of our country as well for every individual player .
i notice that our players are slightly excited , but it 's important that we keep together .
the excitement should n't affect our performance ; it 's a normal condition for every player before each game .
if the player does n't feel any excitement , it means that he 's achieved everything and can end his career . which game in the preliminary round do you consider to be the most important ? the game against spain will be important because it 's the first one .
it will strongly determine the further constellation in our group .
but the two other games are equally important ; that 's why we 'll have to give every game our best .
there are no " games to fill the gap " in a world cup and no weak opponents . who 's the most dangerous opponent in group h ?
and why ? spain is one of the favorites of the tournament , and that 's why we 're preparing thoroughly for this game .
but i consider another team to be the most dangerous opponent and that 's tunisia . african teams are famous for springing surprises .
i think a team that 's coached by roger lemerre is capable of surprises during the world cup 2006 . do you also reckon with stiff competition from saudi arabia ? saudi arabia had more time to prepare , and that does play a big role .
i think we do have to take this team seriously ; it certainly wo n't let itself be just a whipping boy . what is the main strength of the ukrainian team ? our strength lies in our team spirit . bildunterschrift : großansicht des bildes mit der bildunterschrift : ukrainian star striker shevchenko , center , with teammates and what are your weaknesses ? they include personnel problems as well as injuries that have plagued us during our entire preparation phase .
until now we have n't played any test games in the combination that i 'd like to see on the pitch .
andrei shevchenko , sergei rebrov as well as oleg gusev have only trained separately from the rest of the team until now .
our most important man in the defense line-up , sergei fiodorov , wo n't be there at all due to an injury .
four other players had to take part in the junior european championships in portugal until june 4 and are completely exhausted .
i ca n't rely on them 100 percent . which teams do you think have the best chances of making it to the finals ? brazil , italy and germany .
germany 's playing on home turf .
we have a saying : even the walls help you at home .
in addition , it could very well be that the referees are more partial towards the germans . many experts say the success of the ukrainian team depends on whether andrei shevchenko is fit .
is he the only key player in the team ? it 's true that shevchenko does lead the team .
but we 'll be in good form independent of whether he 'll be fit after his last injury and whether he 's in good shape or not .
our performance is n't only based on his dominating role though his talent , and charisma is really important to us and unpleasant to the opponents . what goals do you have at the world cup ? our first goal is to reach the round of 18 .
if we manage that , then we can identify further goals . tatiana petrenko interviewed oleg blokhin -lrb- sp -rrb- send us an e-mail » -pipe- send » -pipe- print » more on the topic dw-world.de germany welcomes the walking wounded the world cup risks being diminished by a number of high-profile absentees .
could the amount of games played in a season threaten the prestige of future cups ?
would a compulsory winter break ensure more stars are fit ?
-lrb- may 29 , 2006 -rrb- interviews with the stars dw-world.de 's interview series gives you the chance to hear from the people who have the most to say when it comes to events on world soccer 's biggest stage .
ronaldinho : this will be brazil 's world cup midfielder ronaldinho is considered by many to be the world 's best soccer player .
dw-world.de spoke with the two-time world footballer of the year about the world cup , family and racism .
-lrb- april 17 , 2006 -rrb- feedback do you think ukraine will make it to the round of 16 ?
send us an e-mail .
please include your name and country in your reply .
